reviews.name: N
reviews.review: Not sure why the reviews imply it’s light weight. Maybe in Novosibirsk? It’s not heavy or light. It’s perfect for most fall winter and spring save for the coldest days. Tons of pockets. Well tailored for athletic body types. Not too tight on the chest, perfect on the shoulders, tapered down to a thinner waist. Sooo comfortable. No Cold draft of wind sneaks in. Get compliments on it every other day — mostly from women though. Works for me. Maybe dudes just need to find this review? If you’d ask I’d tell you where to find it but some of us be weird like that.

reviews.name: LeRoy D
reviews.review: Reviews said 150 lb medium guy should get a medium jacket....its just a fuzz tight . still doable. Also no one mentioned this but the zipper is on the wrong side. zipper head should be on the right for guys, left for girls. otherwise its decent. i'll keep it for what i bought it for.

reviews.name: Nicki
reviews.review: Nice light weight men’s jacket that can be worn casually or for a night out. Pocket are deep for placing keys or other times. Zippers function well. Nice tan color. Hubby loves it.

reviews.name: Joel Williams
reviews.review: I love the style. Don't take size recommendation. If you are XL purchase XL. I was advised to purchase L. Slim fit. Zippers on opposite side of standard men's zipper. No problem...just have to adjust! Overall a very stylish and well made coat.

reviews.name: Tru
reviews.review: I'm 6'3" 215lbs with broad shoulders I got the Xl and it's perfect. Sleeves are long enough to fully cover my arms which is rare. I really like this jacket. I'll probably get more in different colors. Ps. I got the jacket with the hood. The hood is removable and the jacket is lined on the inside with soft materials. Pretty warm.

reviews.name: Deokie Nabrizny
reviews.review: Fit perfect!!!

reviews.review: Ordered this jacket for my son. Nice fit but could be a bit thicker in the lining. He's able to wear his hoodie under it to keep warm so that's a plus.

reviews.name: Customer
reviews.reviewTitle: Good jacket, but buy the next size up
reviews.review: The jacket is good, but buy the next size up if you have a bit of a belly. I can get into the jacket okay, I just can't sit down without unzipping it (luckily) I am still losing weight, so I will get into it comfortably soon.

reviews.name: Rob
reviews.review: It's always kind of hit or miss when you order clothing online. This jacket thankfully fits exactly as I expected. I ordered a 2-XL and it fits perfectly. Also, it is a very nice jacket. I'm lovin' it. Better than I thought it was going to be. How long it will last, I'm not sure but at this point.. I'm very happy with it.

reviews.name: Larry
reviews.reviewTitle: Nice quality and price... wrong sizes though
reviews.review: Like others have said, this jacket is very undersized. I got the XXL and it is almost exactly the same as a normal XL here in Canada. So get at least 1 size up, maybe even 2 - if you have a belly like me. It's not just the gut though, my XXL has the same sleeve length and shoulder clearance as an XL. That's probably the reason why XXL doesn't cost anymore, like most companies charge. Other than the size, the look and quality is nice, especially at this price.

reviews.name: Rich
reviews.review: Great fit. 42-44 Canadian chest size ordered Large fit great  recommended XL. Large was just right. Last fall I ordered a leather winter coat Large. Again Amazon said XL. Large was/is great. Size chart is very confusing.

reviews.name: Trevor Illman
reviews.review: It doesn't look like the picture. Material is different from the picture too. I bought a XXL and it certainly doesn't fit like a XXL. Go a size up if you can. Unfortunately I cannot. I wish I hadn't wasted my time.

title: Berghaus Men's Prism Polartec Interactive Jacket
description: When sunny days take a chilly turn, that's when the prism pt. jacket comes into its own. With a great warmth to weight ratio, the Polartec classic fleece fabric is incredibly soft with a high quality feel. For versatility you can't go wrong as the interactive zip makes it the perfect companion to zip inside a Berghaus interactive jacket for extra weather protection. Plus you're never far from your essentials as zipped hand pockets keep everything safe. So, no matter how changeable the weather, this will match it.

reviews.name: Jasonbtx
reviews.review: Bought to go with my coat. It zips right in, nice and thick. Nice and warm at 15°F. Fits perfect!!

reviews.name: BW
reviews.review: Ordered this jacket to replace the one my husband has worn so much and for so many years that it has holes in it. Great product. Highly recommend. Fit is great and keeps you warm!

reviews.name: Customer
reviews.review: Berghaus is the best, fits well

reviews.name: Tomislav Bacic
reviews.review: it looks a bit big if you wear it over the t-shirt. you need a ticker cloth underneath.

reviews.name: Mark Lawton
reviews.review:
Fortunately for me, the Berghaus I received direct from  (as opposed to a Marketplace seller) is real, and, as expected, it’s a nice one. I know that because I’m a bit of a fatty and I like the cut on Berghaus fleeces because they don’t make me look as if I’m wearing a kaftan.

I am also a real customer, not a bot or a fake review writer, just in case you were wondering.

reviews.name: Herefordshire yokel
reviews.review: Looks like a fake with berghaus labels on. One day of use and the fleece is pilling up and coming away. I've owned these before and never seen this. Buy direct from berghaus, dont buy this junk.

reviews.name: JamMC
reviews.reviewTitle: Can confirm the zips align with the Cornice III Interactive jacket
reviews.review: Bought this for the Cornice III jacket. Purchased the Medium fleece size for a Medium jacket, the zip fittings align well on both garments and had no trouble fitting the fleece to the jacket. There are also two loops at the sleeves which attach to internal fasteners in the jacket sleeve. Soft, comfy material, no complaints so far.

reviews.name: Blueeye
reviews.reviewTitle: Poor quality and was too small
reviews.review: I have purchased Berghaus many time in the past and all their products h@be been great and have fitted well but not this garment it was way too small and th3 quality not very good at all I returned this garment 😡

reviews.name: Hotwired
reviews.review: I bought this to go in a Hillwalker jacket. It fits fine but one thing really irritates me; my wife bought the same product for women and it had really nice internal mesh pockets accesible from inside, useful for gloves, hats etc. The men's version has the same pockets but they are only accesible from the outside, so great when you are wearing this alone but inaccessible when zipped into another jacket as an "INTERACTIVE" lining. A really stupid design fault.

description:
Product Details
Fabric Type
100% Polyester

About this Item
COMFORT STRETCH: Crafted from 100% polyester that offers comfort stretch, this comfortable softshell makes for versatile wear — from the trail to the office.
WATER RESISTANT: don't worry if it starts to drizzle or the wind picks up. The water-and-wind-resistant jacket has you covered.
CLASSIC FIT: This softshell is made with a regular fit cut, for a classic design that you don't have to think twice about.
HANDY FEATURES: Thoughtful touches include an abrasion resistant chin guard, zippered chest and hand pockets, adjustable cuffs, and an adjustable hem.
BUILT TO LAST: Columbia’s attention to detail is what sets our apparel apart. Specifying only the highest quality materials, expert stitching, and craftsmanship. This is a long-lasting garment you will enjoy for seasons to come.
Description

This wind-and-water-resistant softshell will keep you warm—whether you want to stand out or blend right in. It's built for foul-weather outings, with a comfort stretch fit, an adjustable hem, and adjustable cuffs. Made of a durable yet light 100% polyester, with a soft, abrasion resistant chin guard and multiple zippered pockets. Columbia offers this jacket in multiple colors and sizes. Regular Fit. Extended sizing available. To ensure the size you choose is right, utilize our sizing chart and the following measurement instructions: For the sleeves, start at the center back of the neck and measure across the shoulder and down to the sleeve. If you come up with a partial number, round up to the next even number. For the chest, measure at the fullest part of the chest, under the armpits, and over the shoulder blades, keeping the tape measure firm and level.

See more
About this Item

reviews.name: Justice A.
reviews.reviewTitle: Most durable jacket I’ve ever owned.
reviews.review:
I have a black Ascender jacket I purchased back in 2016. I’ve worn it 3-5 times a week, 5 months a year for the last 6 years..
I’ve done yard work, mechanic work, and carpentry work in it consistently during that time. I always knew I could i could throw it in the washer and it come out good as new with the same vibrant color. Until the fateful day I wore it while painting outside..

Acrylic paint doesn’t come off easily, so I had to purchase another for wearing out to dinner and such.. Now my original jacket is worn solely for work and still; Another few months later, no holes or rips in the fabric, and the cuffs and collar are un-frayed and fit perfect.
Amazing stuff!

reviews.name: Mark W
reviews.review: Jacket fits true to size (recommend using the sizing chart). Jacket works well and keeps you warm between 40-50 degrees. If you are looking to layer up with this jacket, I would recommend ordering the next size up. Overall very pleased with this jacket.

reviews.name: Customer
reviews.reviewTitle: The quality is still there for casual Columbia fans.
reviews.review:
I was spooked by some finger reviews saying the quality had drastically dropped but mine came in as advertised. I bought one of these jackets maybe 6 years ago now and I imagine this one will last as long. The only thing is I wished they had lined the collar with the fleece material like on my old one instead of leaving it bare.

Medium fits me perfect for the weather I wear it in (40's to 50's with a t-shirt or light long sleeve shirt. Anything colder requires a heavier coat).

reviews.name: Xavier
reviews.reviewTitle: It's okay, same as a $25 dollar jacket.
reviews.review:
Very expensive $$$$$! You are paying for the name.
You can buy the same jacket for $25 dollar without the name brand.

reviews.name: Appaiah Mallu
reviews.review: Good but my father told me it is bit tight.

reviews.name: Thad Riley
reviews.review: I bought this jacket as a replacement for my previous Columbia jacket that I seem to have lost. That was a great jacket as well but the outer material was different, more of a nylon woven type of material. This jacket is more of a shell. The design is very sharp, smooth and simple. The material is extremely resistant to dirt. I was recently working an event where the jacket was under a table on a concrete floor for the entire day. I was worried about it getting very dirty, but when I pulled it out there was no dirt on it in spite of there being a lot of dust bunnies. Love the jacket and will replace it with the same kind when this one has lived its full life and moved on to jacket heaven.

reviews.name: DaisyGirl51
reviews.reviewTitle: He is between sizes so this was the perfect size to order. Will get a couple of years wear.
reviews.review: Jacket is perfect. Our grandson thought his dad was "sharp" in his and loved it so we got him one for Christmas/ He wore it for his "performance" at his Christmas school program. He loved it!!

reviews.name: Edward G
reviews.review: Exactly what I need.

reviews.name: David Far and Wide
reviews.reviewTitle: Not bad, solidly built. A bit too baggy for me.
reviews.review:
It's a really solidly built softshell - very substantial and definitely not for warm days. Keeps the wind out well and is styled in a way that means it's probably more towards casual wear than technical.

I didn't really love it in the end though because the sizing was too much on the large size. I'm on the small size really - 37" chest, 5'7 height - supposedly a SMALL in Columbia, but although this fit okay, it wasn't the technical or slim fit I was hoping for - more baggy and boxy, hanging off me rather than close to the body. Great if you want a wear a full weight fleece underneath I suppose.

reviews.name: Colin C
reviews.review: After some adjustment this now fits rather well and I am quite pleased although the price, including postage, is higher than direct from Columbia UK.

reviews.name: Vincent Miller
reviews.review: Good quality jacket

reviews.name: Customer
reviews.review: After just a few months of wearing the jacket the zipper broke. Luckily  looked after our problem and had a new jacket sent to us. Columbia`s customer service department was TERRIBLE!!! They wanted me to send the jacket back at my cost so that they could evaluate whether it would be considered under warranty OR go to a tailor to have the zipper fixed. We live very remotely and the nearest tailor is over 2 hours away. When I asked whether there was another option they said NO. Again, Amazon came through for us and reafirmed why I love ordering from them. I won`t be ordering a Columbia product again and give their customer service department a 1 star rating.

reviews.name: Allan Pendlebury
reviews.reviewTitle: Very comfortable but zipper broke after six months and little use.
reviews.review:
It is a very comfortable jacket. It seems to hold wind at bay and although I haven't been out in any heavy rain, just light rain that beaded on the jacket without soaking in. I did read another review where the zipper wasn't heavy enough. It isn't as heavy duty as my last, but so far works well. I will practice more care when doing it up; just in case.
5/15/22: Edit: Just out walking dog in what I would say was moderate to heavy rain and stayed dry under jacket.
Something else I forgot to mention: I really like the breast zipper pocket to store my smartphone while hiking.
10/24/22: Edit: Zipper broke this AM. I haven't worn it over summer so not that much use; have to reduce the stars to 1. Everything else is fine but it has become a throw away and search for another jacket with sturdy zipper.

About this Item

reviews.name: Justin
reviews.review:
I feel like I got very lucky with my purchase here. I pulled the trigger on the tall and am so glad that I did because it's just the right length in the arms and the torso. For reference, I'm 6'3 and around 210lbs and I got the large tall. I would opt for XL a lot of the time but with reviews saying this ran big I decided to stick with the large.

This is made of really sturdy materials. Not as sturdy as something like a Carhartt for example, which in my opinion is almost too tough (and quite a bit more expensive), but it feels like this is built to last a good while. The detachable hoodie part is a really cool touch. The wrist cuffs have two buttons for a looser or tighter fit. The inside of the torso is sherpa while the inside of the arms is a nice quilted material. The front pockets for your hands are on the sides, although the pictures make it seem like they would go in under a flap. I got the brown version (lighter one) and it's exactly as pictured. Overall I'm happy with this coat overall and look forward to perhaps buying other colors.

reviews.name: Barredbard
reviews.reviewTitle: A Great Fit for an Understated Look
reviews.review:
I had always wanted a winter coat that didn't quite look like one, or have the bulk and heft of one. The somewhat pseudo-military or even quasi-cowboy look has always appealed to me. I am thrilled with this coat. I usually wear a large, but with winter coats I tend to get a size up, to accommodate any garments underneath. It was the right call. The look is crisp and understated, which is what I was going for. With the hood, it's a blend of the trendy, with the classic.

As I wore it for the first time, I thought the only thing missing is the ability to remove the hood at my option. I checked, and low and behold, the hood can be unzipped and removed. I am not sure why this important feature was not mentioned. I almost did not buy it because I was debating that white hood. The fact that it can be removed is excellent.

Great coat.

reviews.name: Malckiah
reviews.review: I bought an XXL based on what everyone was saying. I ended up sending back for XL which I never do... but when I got the wrong size I could see that this jacket was WELL worth the money. Definitely a good quality jacket that will keep you warm. I would definitely reccomend and it was worth the trouble to send it back for the right size. I am 5"10... 190lbs... XL is perfect for me.

reviews.name: Louis arc
reviews.reviewTitle: Fits comfortably but durability is questionable
reviews.review: After less than a year with this jacket, a portion of the back has a rip about 7 inches long and has exposed the cotton underneath. I would like to arrange for a replacement if possible because it is a nice jacket but can't continue wearing it as is.

reviews.name: Aqueeta Parker
reviews.review: I have been looking for a jacket for my boyfriend for some time and finally stumbled on this on. It is a perfect fit, he is 5’11 200 lbs, just below is waist. We got it in a size large, it is the perfect jacker for the rainy winter season because it works well at a rain jacket as well as a layered winter coat.

reviews.name: Lanloesh
reviews.review: Comfort and warmth are the standouts for this jacket. You're essentially getting a hoodie and a jacket in one. The feel is top notch and I feel like I could wear it all day.

reviews.name: E. Brooks
reviews.review: My husband is broad shouldered and slim waisted, he is also tall. Got him an XL and it was too large through the body and much too small through the shoulders.

reviews.name: robert dolan
reviews.reviewTitle: I like how it looks and feels
reviews.review: Step above a Hoodie jacket can wear with other jackets under the coat or with a coat over it very warm I have 2 of them now.

reviews.name: rjg.1969
reviews.review: Good fit. Quality jacket. Quality brand.

reviews.name: P Williamson
reviews.review: Excellent fit

reviews.name: Glen
reviews.review:
I love the look of this jacket, but I must say the quality has left me disappointed. The fit is not overly generous for the size I bought, but it's OK. The main issues I have had are that the zipper pull broke on day one - not a big problem, I was able to rig a replacement, and yesterday (just after the return period closed), a seam on the right sleeve at the back of the shoulder opened up about 4 inches. I had to take the jacket to a tailor to repair it. I have only worn the jacket a few times so far, so there's no way it should be coming apart already. Really not impressed.

Update 22-2-22 - today the seam on other sleeve came apart as I was simply reaching up to take off my hat. This jacket is SUCH poor quality - I STRONGLY ADVISE AGAISNT BUYING ONE. I will be contacting the seller to see if they will refund, even though the date has passed.

reviews.name: Mau
reviews.review: Me encantan los materiales, el forro, el teñido y la talla. Creo que es la primera prensa que siento me convenció en todo aspecto

reviews.name: Customer
reviews.review: Way too short on me, bought a large and the only sizing charts are for chest size but nothing about length. I am 6'4" and unfortunately only realized it didn't fit after I removed the tags. Every shirt I own sticks out the bottom of the jacket. I like the quality of it though but it would be nice if I knew what size would actually fit me.

About this Item

reviews.name: Ace Traveller
reviews.review:
Let me start by saying that I have not had this jacket long enough to know how it will hold up over time but so far this jacket is amazing.

Fit
At 6'2" / 200 (long legs) I was tempted to get the XL but got the Large as I wanted something really light as I have a full winter coat but could not be happier with sizing of the Large.

Materials
This jacket has a really soft and water resistant outer skin. I placed my arm under my water spigot and the water just bounced off and two quick shakes of my arm and it was dry. The inner liner is very good at storing body heat so you could probably get away with this being a three season jacket if you live in an area with relatively mild winters.

Features
There are four pockets on the jacket I have, two traditional waist-level jacket pockets on the left and right with an inner pocket and an outer left arm pocket. The two hand pockets are decent but a little shallower than I expected. The inner pocket is nicely sized and readily falls to hand. I will likely never use left arm pocket as it feels odd to access and awkward to zip back up. Speaking of zippers, all of them appear to be of at least decent quality as the zippers feel decently robust and the tracks are metal. It is a bit annoying that the main zipper on this jacket is on the left which is different than any other jacket I have owned and takes a little brain retraining to get use to.

Overall
I have spent a lot of money on jackets in the past but also got my money's worth. I went a bit cheaper this time but I am pretty impressed even in the short time I've worn this one. I will add an edit if this impression changes due to unexpected quirks or wear.

reviews.name: G Unit
reviews.review: Jacket is nice. But shipped wrapped in plastic bag. Put in washer, hung to dry and then steamed on low setting to get all the wrinkles out. I would never wear the jacket as shipped. The wrinkles are bad.

reviews.name: Kindle Customer
reviews.review: I wore the official military flight jacket for years, i wore it out after 20 yrs, so I was looking for a replacement, and this came highly reviewed, so I figured what the heck. It arrived as stated, and in pretty flat shipping bag. I was alittle disappointed because it lack the sheen like the photo, but I wore it outside the next day, 50F, and sunny, I got really warm fast and had open up the zipper, it moves well and fit nice, will be my yard work and local hiking and walking jacket on those cool days.

reviews.name: Woods13
reviews.review: Decent coat for the money. Not as warm for winter weather as I had hoped. Polyester fill is fairly thin.

reviews.name: Dave Garcia
reviews.review: I bought this for my son-in-law for Christmas. He really liked it. He said even though it is not overly bulky, it was still warm. A good buy I think.

reviews.name: Joel gallegos
reviews.review: Like how warm it is! Can wear casual or just put on with some sweats! Perfect for both

reviews.name: Karleesha
reviews.reviewTitle: Keeps you warm , light weight , Great for the price
reviews.review: No dislikes . The jacket was a Gift for my boyfriend for Christmas . He loves it .

reviews.name: Repairman
reviews.reviewTitle: Nice jacket, but the zipper is on the wrong side.
reviews.review: Nice lightweight windbreaker jacket but the zipper is on the wrong side.

reviews.name: AD VAN DYK
reviews.review:
I thought it would be much thicker. But it's really flimsy. Not suitable for winter at all. The size is good. I'm 6.2 and ordered an XL.
I also have a real Alpha Industries genuine bomber jacket and it's 10x thicker than this one. Also the green is not like on the picture advertised.
OH well, I'll wear it in the spring and fall.

reviews.name: Canada Neu
reviews.reviewTitle: YOU WILL NOT GET WHAT YOU SAW ON THEIR ADS.
reviews.review:
As first sight, it looked a well made wind breaker but details and quality don't match what they shown.
Joint of elastic waistband and main body is single, not doubled stitches like their photo shown. Inside pocket is the same (single stitch). Zipper is cheap looking and not even close to what they showed on the photos. Pencil pocket is made with single layer of fabric with no thicken edge. If you use this, soon the fabric will be torn.
Someone mentioned that inside smells like old insulation. I agree. It has old hay like smell. I'm not sure if the smell goes away eventually. You need to order one size bigger than what you normally buy.
What they showed as good features/quality are not there. You should check your jacket very closely if you bought one. The price is reasonable but YOU WILL NOT GET WHAT YOU SAW ON THEIR AD.

reviews.name: Ryan Kells
reviews.review: My jacket order was fast. Ordered on Sunday, received on Wednesday. Colour (navy) and quality as advertised. It;s not a puffy coat and it's not real thin. Somewhere in between. Size chart and sizing is accurate. I'm 5' 10, 210 lbs (size 46 suit jacket), I ordered an XL and it's great. My son is 5' 11", 175 and the XL is not too big but L would be perfect. Zipper was a LITTLE wonky like others have mentioned in their reviews. All in all, very satisfied.

reviews.name: Laurence Dube
reviews.reviewTitle: Nice quality and good looking but size chart is seems to be missing
reviews.review: I like the material and model of this jacket. Tend to get puffed up a bit since there are air pocket in the insulation. Nothing major but this jacket won't drop super straight on you. Giving only 4 stars because middle zipper is a bit hard to start and there were a couple of loose threads of fabric I had to remove here and there. All seems ok but was not expecting to do this with a 50$ jacket. The size chart was missing to ended up ordering a Medium and a Large. I am 5'10'' and weight 180 lbs. Large was perfect for me. I am super satisfied of the look of the jacket.

reviews.name: Kent
reviews.review:
For me this jacket is perfect! Zipper works great and YES it is LH but that is traditional in this style jacket. Just get used to that guys! Although it weighs next to nothing it slips on easily and is perfect warmth for me even here in Northern Ontario. Yeah dead of winter I will be layering anyway and I do have a parka this is the COLD NORTH! Most of the year this is going to a perfect casual jacket!
I don't know why so many are complaining about the quality this is really nicely sewn and all the zippers work smoothly etc.. Do yourself a favor and give it a try!

reviews.name: Avant
reviews.reviewTitle: Good cheaper alternative but not for heavy use
reviews.review:
I bought for the purpose of travel and outdoor use in those times where temps can change drastically from 70F in the morning down to 40F at night.

I got this on sale for $20 which was a far cry from $60-120 asking price of other packable down jackets. For the price, it's much warmer than I thought and has well thought out features. So far I've worn this in 42F weather, coldest and just going on a walk I was breaking a bit of a sweat with it half zipped. It has 2 exterior pockets and 2 internal pockets. Personally I wouldn't put too much in these, as I can really feel the thing stretch and drag down. Just gloves, hat, phone etc. should be fine, nothing like a can of soda or something. Water resistance is what you expect for thin nylon stuff, a few drops is fine, actual rain, get an umbrella or an actual waterproof layer. It's also pretty windproof, took it out in the aftermath of a pseudo hurricane and didn't feel the wind.

It packs down pretty well into a 6 inch long 3 inch or so bundle but nothing like the high tech hiking stuff, I just wish there was a shorter loop so I can carabiner it to my pack easier but seems like it was intended to be carried like an umbrella. Also wish it packed into itself rather than have a bag which may get lost one day. The material imo isn't very durable, I have no rips yet, but I'm not confident and think if I rub on something the wrong way it's going to tear. The stitching seems fine so far, and doesn't seem to be leaking filler yet.

Sizing wise, I have a 45 chest and usually wear XL, but this is kinda big even for an XL, maybe because they were antiicpating you layer something like a thick sweater underneath. It is also a bit long for my torso, about 2-3 inches more than I need to sit at my waist. I have 23 sleeves and that fits perfect.

I don't expect this to last a long time, but it's useful for the time I'll have it.

12/28 edit:
So I just used this exactly for what I bought it for because of the huge winter storm that swept across the north and east coast US. Temps went from nearly 60 degrees in daytime all the way down to 23 by late afternooon with extremely high winds that were throwing doors around and knocked some street signs off their mounts, and it was perfect. I just had a t-shirt underneath and on top of this was a gymax waterproof windproof jacket. Again my only complain might be if the material doesn't last and it's a bit long.

reviews.name: Christopher Zele
reviews.review:
I was able to snag one of these puffer jackets for my Step Dad for $21 for Christmas. It runs a little bit big and he normally is a Medium, but I bought him a Small and that seems it will be perfect for him. The quality of the material is very nice they used a good filler and the jacket feels nice when I tried it on to see how it would fit. Most puffer jackets are $40 or $30, so when I saw this for the low $20s I had to pick one up.

You can fold this puffer jacket up into a ball, which is a nice plus if you're hiking somewhere cold and it warms up in the afternoon and you want to put the jacket away.

This jacket definitely feels like a $40+ product. I own an Old Navy Puffer Jacket, which I've used for years and a Patagonia one. This  one is very close in quality to the Old Navy one. It feels good to the touch and looks sharp.

If I was in the market for another gift for someone, or I needed another puffer jacket for myself I would definitely buy an Amazon Basics because they're both cheap and high-quality.

reviews.name: Nunya001
reviews.reviewTitle: Big Performance for a very low cost
reviews.review:
I bought this jacket to wear at work - I make a wood product and I'm outside in all weather. I need jackets to be no fuss and functional but also affordable so if I tear it, spill oil on it, burn it with welding sparks I can shrug it off and buy a new one. As a point of reference Patagonia is my personal go to outdoor wear supplier, but that's way too expensive for work.

I've been wearing this jacket now for a couple of months. Just went out in 13 F with pretty decent wind gusting - warm and comfortable. It's cut allows good movement and it's not so bulky so you can put a shell over it in wet weather, although I've worn it in the rain without a shell and it does pretty well. I'm 6'2 185 with long arms and a medium fits just right. I wish it was 4 inches shorter - that's my only suggestion.

reviews.name: Dan
reviews.reviewTitle: Depends on the fit you like. See more for good info.
reviews.review:
Really great for the price $22 I got a large and ordering a 2nd that is medium, if I used it a lot (or it cost more) I would get something more durable like a name brand. But price wins and it is warm, it works for what I use it for. The fit is more of a traditional fit that is to say a large is baggy for my slim fit preference. I am a man who is 190lbs 5'11. Before the pndmic I was 175 (got gains) and would have gotten a small knowing the sizes haha #goals.

If you want a long term thermal go buy a brand name it will look 6 times better, but this thing has its place for sure!! I like things more tight fitted and in my post pndmic body i'd get a medium or probably a small to wear under a jacket. So if I was 175-180 i'd probably get a small I think to wear under stuff, but a medium if its the main thing and you don't like fitted clothes.

I planned to get 2 of these with one to wear to work and another to get dirty from yard work and outside things. I first ordered a large and it is baggy for my preference but probably what most men would want. I like fitted clothes and have ordered another one in size medium to wear to work. I am keeping the large for yard work and other things. Great to have 2 or 3 instead of one high priced item.

Hope it helps!

reviews.name: Clau
reviews.review: Está increíble la calidad. Es muy similar a las chamarras Uniqlo, con una diferencia de precio enorme. Se guarda perfectamente bien en su bolsita y no pesa prácticamente nada. Es calientita. Básica para los viajes. El color es igual a las fotos de la publicación de , y viene ligeramente jaspeado el tono. Viene amplia. Estaba dudando entre la L y la XL y compré la L y acerté. Si estás entre dos tallas escoge la pequeña. Súper recomendada! Si esta reseña te fue útil da click en me gusta para evaluar si escribir otras reseñas

reviews.name: Customer
reviews.review: So I have to say I had rock bottom expectations buying this. But corona has been good to me and I’ve lost 30 kg in the last year. As such basically nothing fits me. Therefore in desperation I turned to  to help me out. The coat is lightweight. Folds super small in the provided bag. Has a nice matte finish. Sizing is good. I’m 175cm and 71kg - the small is just a shade too big. Otherwise really happy.

reviews.name: JHK
reviews.review:
Im a 46" chest and a 36" waist. Im 6'0".
My normal size to go to is XL.  apparently knows this and recommended a 2XL.
However, having read the reviews I went for my go to size XL.
It arrived. Way too big. So I returned it using their carrier which was EVRI which annoyed me cos I thought I could return via the  shop which is much easier. EVRI system and machines are shocking.
I then ordered the L. Very rarely do I do that as they are normally too tight.
It arrived. Fits fine on the chest and shoulders , arms and length, but the waist is a bit baggy and loose. It's like for a 39" waist I would say. ( I do train/swim a lot and have a v shape)
Im being super fussy, but for £37 I feel I should be. I am sticking with it as I figure a M would be too tight.
Another thing. It is a female zip. Zips up on the wrong side. No big deal these days as we are alll meant to be one and the same right? Just letting you all know that's all.
Hope this helps. Surely Amazon Essentials should be able to get sizing and measurement information right and show it with the products.
Come on Amazon. I love you but you really should give more information and more accurate sizing with your products. Hope this helps you as requested.

reviews.name: Tony K
reviews.review: Truly surprised by how warm this jacket is. It’s feather light and my first thought was that it is pretty thin so my expectations were pretty low. How wrong was I? I work outdoors in N Scotland and already in Oct temperatures are only 4 or 5C. I’ve been wearing it under my overalls instead of a fleece and wow it’s warm. It isn’t an Arctic level puffa jacket but I think that’s fairly obvious but it’s way warmer than a fleece, not at all bulky and fabulous value for money. I definitely recommend it

reviews.name: Jay Dee
reviews.review:
...with this jacket.

It is everything it claims to be in the description and despite being lightweight it is pleasingly warm [snug as a bug actually].

The stitching is excellent and I found no loose threads. It has two external zipped pockets and two large inside lower front quite deep pouch pockets. The zip, in keeping with the 'lightweight' theme is quite narrow but works well and zips right up to the top of the collar.

Size-wise I would say it is 'true to size' bearing in mind what you may be wearing under the jacket in cooler times.

reviews.name: Texas Mimi
reviews.review:
My hubby loses jackets frequently because he's on a job site, takes them off and they disappear.
He needed (another) casual jacket. Nothing to big and heavy like a coat. Just something for cold mornings but easy to stash when the day warms up. I picked this jacket because of the cost, to be honest. $15?? I figured it would be thin and cheap but if he lost this one too, no great loss. What a surprise when it arrived. A nice mid-weight fleece, heavy duty zipper, looks good, and looks like something I paid a lot more for. He's even hanging on to this one and hasn't lost it yet! Highly recommend!11

reviews.name: DJL
reviews.reviewTitle: Cozy and warm! But sizing is kind of crazy.
reviews.review:
It's soft, relatively light, and warm. I planned to use it as an under-layer on bike rides, but now find that it is also quite comfortable to wear while puttering around indoors.

The sizing makes no sense.  displayed "large will fit you best", but large was hopelessly long and baggy. The one I'm wearing in the picture is a medium size, which is comfortable but still a little too long for use with an outer shell-type bicycling jacket. I also purchased a small in a different color (forest green), but it is slightly tight in the stomach -- and still too long!

The camo colored one (medium size) is made in Vietnam. The forest green (small size) one is from Indonesia, and seems slightly less soft.

reviews.name: Brandon
reviews.review: I’ve always been told that I’m cheap. I don’t think that’s a fair description, I just like to find the best bang for my buck… and I like to reuse paper towels lol. If you can find this fleece on sale like I did, buy it. It’s a really good find. I live in Maryland and it’s cold out right now. This fleece fits great and is keeping me warm. I’m also impressed with its comfort and zippered pockets. The pockets are really useful because they are deep pockets. So if you put your phone in one and forget to zip it up, you don’t have the feeling that anything will slip out of your pocket as you bend over to pick something up off the floor (like I do 300 times a day with my four y/o daughter)

reviews.name: WannabeTechie
reviews.reviewTitle: Could be a North Face or Patagonia
reviews.review:
I'm 5' 9" and 175 lbs. Got an XL b/c I like things a little loose. It does look a tad big on me but I would still get this over a L if you like loose clothing.

Overall... great deal! This green/black look makes it look a little more unique than the other mono colors. If you were to slap a Patagonia or North Face logo on here, no one could ever know the difference. Warm and stylish.

reviews.name: samlanus
reviews.review:
12/07/2022 reviewed again: I bought two Large at the very first time.
I am 5’7” tall.177lbs weight. It fits me perfectly. Three days after I receive them. I bought another one for myself again and two for my brothers. This  Essentials Polar fleece jacket is soft and warm. It’s thickness is medium, thick enough to keep me warm.. That’s why I would like to give 5 Stars Plus. I sewed the issue by myself.
Amazon Essentially product lines are as reliable as just like Costco’s Kirkland brand. Love it.

Large size is perfect for me. I would like to give this fleece jacket 5 stars plus. Everything about the jacket is perfect. Very resonable price,very comfortable,very good quality... But the huge pockets inside have not sewn on purpose. I don't know why. The other brand of jackets with big pockets never have the issue like this.
Don't put your cell phone inside the big pocket.

Suggestion to Amazon: Please sew the pockets completely.

reviews.name: kcinAlaska
reviews.review: I ordered one of these jackets for my husband in late summer. He loved it and wore in right into cold weather. He loved it so much that he had me order two more! He can no longer wear them in our Alaska winter weather, but since we keep our house at 68 degrees in the winter, he now wears one around the house. They are just perfect in every way - fit, comfort, warmth and, most of all: affordability. Oh, he wished me to add that they have great pockets - the outside pockets zip shut, plus there are two inner pockets. How could I forget that - he has raved about the pockets. Thank you so much.

reviews.name: Matthew Hall
reviews.review: I bought it excepting a regular jacket similar to Walmart quality but I was surprised because this  Essentials jacket seemed closer to the quality from stores in a mall. I only planned on buying one because I won't need jackets that often where I live but I believe I'll buy a 2nd one, if anything to have a spare. If anyone is on the fence about it being a basic Amazon brand, in my experience it's as good as name brand.

reviews.name: JustAnotherName12
reviews.review:
Long story short, this is the second fleece that I've bought over a couple of years. The first one that I purchased was in a regular size (not tall) and the fit was nice enough for me to wear holes in but the sleeves were a little on the short side. If I extended my arms out in front of me, the cuff of the sleeve would miss my wrist by about 4 inches. So with this purchase, I decided to account for that issue and I ordered a Tall size...now the cuff of the sleeves are like 5 inches too long. The rest of the fit is great, but the sleeve length needs to be dialed in a little better.

(FYI, I'm only 6'1" but I usually by Tall when ordering shirts)

reviews.name: ✅ SteP ✅
reviews.reviewTitle: ESSENTIAL NEL NOME MA NON DI FATTO - CALD, MORBIDO E PERFETTO PER IL FREDDO
reviews.review:
🟥 🟧 🟨 🟩 🟦 🟪 🟫🟥 🟧 🟨
🚫 TEST E CONSIDERAZIONI: 🚫
🟥 🟧 🟨 🟩 🟦 🟪 🟫🟥 🟧 🟨
Felpa acquistata a marzo 2019 e recensisco ora, maggio 2020, a distanza di oltre 1 anno, dopo averla indossata parecchio, specialmente per stare nei dintorni di casa, non essendo elegante, ma davvero molto molto calda e pratica.

Le lampo con cordino permettono di allacciarla e slacciarla al volo, sono davvero toste, sia quella per la chiusura della felpa che quelle delle tasche, sono lampo con chiusura femminile, ovvero al contrario di quella maschile, per intenderci il cursore lo farete scorrere con la mano destra anzichè con quella sinistra come sono abituati gli uomini, ma poco male è questione di abitudine.

La felpa è in pile, molto comodo, caldo e soffice, tiene davvero caldo in inverno pieno anche con venticello moderato, ovviamente se il vento è consistente l'aria passa, non essendo fatta di materiali wind stop.

Risulta discretamente traspirante, tanto da non mettersi sonovuoto quando la indossate.

Io sono alto 175cm e peso circa 72Kg, ho preso la taglia S e mi calza alla perfezione, stretta ma non troppo, perfetta di maniche. Le tasche con cerniera sono comode e profonde. Non si tratta di un capo alla moda ma adatto a coloro che lavorano e che necessitano di un indumento caldo per l'inverno da mettere magari sotto la giacca per poi poterlo utilizzare da solo in caso la giornata si scaldi leggermente.

Sono totalmente soddisfatto, nonostante le finiture non precise anzi, tutt'altro, il proprio dovere lo fa egregiamente, tiene caldo e dopo 1 anno di lavaggi praticamente settimanali è ancora soffice e perfetto, difficile pretendere di più.

🟥 🟧 🟨 🟩 🟦 🟪
🔹 CONCLUSIONI:🔹
🟥 🟧 🟨 🟩 🟦 🟪
Al prezzo di 18 euro a marzo 2019 (attualmente 19,99 euro) è difficile pretendere di più da questo genere di indumenti, non di certo adatti a situazioni eleganti ma pià che altro a situazioni pratiche in cui l'efficacia passa in secondo piano rispetto alla bellezza dell'indumento. Diversi colori disponibili ma il camouflage verde è quello che mi ha colpito di più.

Inserisco qualche foto e vi ringrazio per la lettura
Stefano

reviews.name: Arthur R.
reviews.review:
Sadly this product was disappointing considering all the positive reviews.
Firstly the zip fastener stuck and I put it down to being new or perhaps because it was on the LHS, but after numerous tries I decided it was faulty.
Also the L size fitted my arms in length and was comfortable but the body was way too small. And that's the problem with buying stuff on line. One man's large is another man's small.
It was however lightweight and what I wanted but...................

reviews.name: 🇮🇹 Schälflj 🇮🇹
reviews.reviewTitle: Apprezzabile comfort, calore e vestibilità, nonostante la economicità del capo
reviews.review:
Mi piacciono le camicie e le giacche sportive a quadrettoni e quando ho notato questa giacca in pile della serie AMAZON ESSENTIALS, con delle caratteristiche in descrittiva che erano interessanti, ho deciso di acquistarla per utilizzarla in campagna nelle nostre zone collinari, anche durante le escursioni con i miei cani.

La giacca arriva in una busta trasparente perfettamente piegata e non appena rimosso il capo ho potuto subito constatare una apprezzabile QUALITA' complessiva della giacca tutto sommato discreta, pur sempre proporzionata alla caratteristica economica del prodotto.

Considerando che siamo infatti difronte ad una GIACCA in PILE di fascia economica e piuttosto sportiva, non mi è dispiaciuta la scelta del tessuto integralmente sintetico (100% poliestere) che sebbene si percepisce subito risulta comunque sufficientemente morbida e piacevole sulla pelle.

Apprezzabile ho trovato anche il suo CONFEZIONAMENTO sufficientemente curato ed attento ai particolari, come entrambe le TASCHE esterne con CHIUSURA a CERNIERA, la ampia TASCA INTERNA aperta e l’ELASTICO ai POLSINI, senza trascurare la CERNIERA LAMPO FRONTALE, che però presenta l’unico “difetto” di essere al contrario, ovvero al femminile, scelta che ammetto non ho compreso e che in alcune circostanze mi procura qualche rallentamento nella chiusura.

A proposito della CERNIERA LAMPO, non si tratta di una marca nota YKK come indicato in alcune recensioni, ma in questa colorazione rosso-bisonte è una più economica che però svolge egregiamente il suo compito, con innesti sufficientemente precisi e scorrimenti fluidi in apertura come in chiusura, peccato solo per il montaggio al contrario a cui molti dovranno abituarsi.

Mi è piaciuta invece la tonalità del TESSUTO a QUADRETTONI rosso/blu dallo stile vagamente nord americano, con un PESO medio ed una sufficiente morbidezza, che mi ha piacevolmente sorpreso per il CALORE che garantisce, perfetto per la stagione fredda in arrivo.

Considerando inoltre la economicità di questo pile, trovo comunque gradevole il confezionamento della giacca, senza evidenti difetti e con quel colletto alto chiudibile con la cerniera lampo fin sotto il mento, per una linea complessiva piacevole che gli conferisce una certa personalità e carattere.

Il TAGLIO è ovviamente sportivo ed indovinando la propria TAGLIA corretta, la VESTIBILITA' risulta comunque discreta.
Neppure le MANICHE le ho trovate abbondanti in lunghezza come a volte accade ed avendo seguito le indicazioni in descrittiva ho scelto correttamente la M.
Si tratta di una MISURA che per me che normalmente indosso giacche taglia 48 è risultata corretta, senza abbondanza ma una apprezzabile comodità, che mi permette di vestire il PILE con sotto anche una camicia, una polo o comunque un ulteriore capo.

Dopo aver considerato attentamente le misure indicate in descrittiva, come da altri evidenziato suggerisco di valutare di acquistare una TAGLIA IN MENO a quella che normalmente si è abituati a vestire, si tratta infatti di un capo che veste largo e non ho neppure riscontrato la vita stretta come segnalata nelle descrizioni.

Nel cercare di offrire dei riferimenti i più precisi possibili in relazione alle MISURE della TAGLIA M da me ordinata, se vado a misurare la giacca a riposo su un appendiabiti, i valori che posso confermare sono:
TORACE (solo frontale) 54.5 cm, SPALLE 43 cm, VITA (solo frontale) 52 cm, MANICA 65 cm da fine spalla a polsino.

La giacca si indossare bene, non lega, non vincola nei movimenti, consentendo di vestire sotto ancora un ulteriore capo non troppo aderente come una camicia.
Il capo infatti non stringe ne a vita come neppure sulle spalla e garantisce quel calore che potrà migliorare il comfort quotidiano durante i primi abbassamenti di temperature di fine autunno - inizio inverno, pur non essendo eccessivamente spesso.

Le CUCITURE e quindi il confezionamento del tessuto, risultano discrete e sempre in linea con la tipologia sportiva/economica del capo, un pile che comunque non stona abbinato ad un paio di pantaloni sportivi, anche dei semplici jeans, per una abbigliamento molto informale e pratico che trovo apprezzabile nella nostra zona collinare di campagna, ma anche da utilizzare semplicemente in giardino o durante le escursioni con i nostri cani.

Nel complesso mi sento quindi di promuovere questa giacca della serie AMAZON ESSENTIALS, per le caratteristiche complessive del capo, acquistato a fine ottobre 2022 al PREZZO di 12.45 euro nella taglia M color ROSSO BISONTE, un costo che ritengo equilibrato.
L'ultima verifica che andrà fatta è la reazione del tessuto dopo i primi lavaggi, ma è probabile che valuterò di acquistare altre colorazioni più classiche.

In quanto alla spedizione e consegna da parte di , sono state anche in questa circostanza efficienti e puntuali grazie al servizio Prime.
Mi auguro che questa recensione possa essere di aiuto e se avete dubbi o quesiti non esitate a chiedere.

reviews.name: Mr D
reviews.review:
This may not be the best fleece jacket you will ever own, but it could well be the best value for money. Fleece is a fairly basic material that is reasonably warm, highly breathable and fairly light weight, compared to say wool. However it offers almost no protection against wind or rain so is best suited to being worn as a mid layer.
This jacket offers almost no frills e.g. no shoulder or elbow reinforced patches, no 2 way zip and not even a hem cord with cord locks. However most of these features merely add weight and cost and provide very little benefit in the real world.
Ultimately what really matters are decent materials, good quality construction and accurate sizing and happily this jacket is very good when it comes to these criteria.
Overall this jacket provides good warmth, from a mid weight material, being around twice the weight of a micro fleece fabric. It fits me very well and the slightly elasticated cuffs and hem are sufficient to keep out any draughts. There are two hand warming outer pockets with zips and additionally 2 large inside “poacher” pockets big enough for a Ordnance Survey map but much more likely to be used for a hat or light weight windproof shirt/waterproof smock. The poacher pockets also provide a useful double layer of insulation, like wise the collar also has double thickness of material
If worn under a Goretex type jacket you may miraculously find that the jacket suddenly becomes far less leak prone. This is because around 99% of the moisture inside the jacket is not in fact rain coming in, but sweat that cannot get out, but can be managed very effectively by the fleece.

reviews.name: B.M.
reviews.review: Other reviewers have complained about the zip on “wrong” side, but a more serious problem is that the 2 very useful inside pockets have slit holes in the bottom (maybe to allow MP3 headphones to be threaded through?) which makes them useless for keys, coins, smaller phones (my iPhone SE goes straight through). So you need an obliging lady with needle and thread to fix this first before you lose your stuff. Otherwise, an OK fleece, with two front zip pockets, rather loose fit on the chest, but good value for money.

reviews.name: joel oleta
reviews.reviewTitle: felt like it wasnt going to do the job, i was wrong its great
reviews.review:
Well i bought this so i can have an affordable puffer jacket i can abuse and not feel bad about. used it for everything and anything that involved being cold outside.
Not wanting to risk expensive jacket incase i ruin it or hate it i purchased this one but so far it has withstood the abuse. i am pleased with the purchase and i recommend it if your in the market for this item and price is an issue . i have used it for concerts ,camping ,late night shopping trips ,taking out the trash at 4 am also just for the random day hikes .
things i like it packs really small and is very light it also comes with its own drawstring bag that seams to match the color you purchased , i think anyhow because i have purchased 4 different colors (Christmas presents for family members ) and all come this way.
Also this thing does very well in windy conditions it seams to have a very thin feel for a puffer jacket but the small amount of insulations paired with the inner and outer shell of jacket material reminds me of safety blankets ability to reflect body heat back to you this feature for staying warm is doing great for lack of "poof".
i took this to a outdoor concert in LA (besame mucho) and it was very cold and windy because of concert rules only small see through bags were allowed so i brought this jacket in its drawstring bag and took a very small amount of space and was perfect for the situation kept me warm through the whole night night. had very large outside pockets with zipper closures and very deep inside pocket behind the outside zip up ones, they seam to share the space keep this in mind when placing bulky items one side will use space from the other even thought they are separate a pocket . the hoody does not have draw strings but i dont feel needs them i think we have gotten use to everything needing drawstrings, it is a bit spacious inside the hood i guess if you have a beanie or a baseball style cap it should fit fine and extends just before the bill of cap. i just hated that they tried to ship it in no box just a clear see through bag the first time had to return arrived damaged.
In new condition its durability is uncertain until this point it has held up (2months), not sure yet the feel is not the toughest it has a thin feel but notably i have not torn it and it has at least been through the wash once keep in mind i airdried all this said it looks brand new and is in great shape , i would whole heartedly recommend this jacket just look for the deals also get the vest for an added layer of warmth

reviews.name: Bill O.
reviews.reviewTitle: Runs a little big but does a good job of being a lightweight jacket
reviews.review:
The main purpose of a lightweight jacket is to keep you warm when it's cool outside but not super cold. For me that means I purchased this jacket for temps between 35 and 60. I wouldn't want to rely on it any colder than that. For that purpose, it does extremely well. I don't feel too hot wearing it in the upper 50s, and as long as I don't spend hours outside when it's in the 30s, it keeps me warm.

My only knock is that the sizing feels like it is from 20 years ago when everything was a bit more loose fitting. That's good if you want to layer up, but the styling is not the current trend of slim/ form fitting. Since I'm an older guy now, that's not as important to me, but it may be for others.

reviews.name: Linda-Lu
reviews.review:
I bought a man’s jacket for the extra length and larger pockets. I know the sleeves are too long. But idm. I’ll just roll them up. A size down would’ve been better, but there’s nothing wrong with a little extra space for layering. (I’m not doing any fashion shows). My comfort is my priority.

The jacket feels good on. It’s light weight.
It stores nicely into the sack provided and comes out wrinkle-free. It allows for a sufficient/confortable heat and is rain resistant (in a light rain). I tested it out today.

Overall, I am VERY VERY happy with this jacket. I’m glad I bought it.

I only wish I had another one to alternate between colors.

reviews.name: Breck
reviews.review: Is this the best puffer jacket you can get? Probably not. Is it a fantastic value, high-quality puffer jacket for a fraction of the price of others? You betcha. Very pleased with this jacket. I did order a size up and I'm glad I did. I typically wear an XL, but I ordered an XXL so I can wear it over thicker hoodies and sweaters and I'm glad I did. I don't think the XL would be as comfortable over bulky layers. The XXL is almost too big though, I wish there was like a 1.5 or something. But I'm still very happy with it. It's a higher quality jacket than I was anticipating. It's very lightweight and packs up super small when you need it to. If you're looking for a quality jacket for chilly weather, you won't be disappointed.

reviews.name: Jerry L.
reviews.review: If you need or want a good puff jacket that you can easily pack into your hiking pack and a just in case you need it jacket this is it. I have a Columbia one as well that is much warmer to be honest but I got this more for cool fall days, it is truly worth the price. When it gets wet I do not feel like it is making me wet so it has good weather resistance. If you are a guy who is not small order a size up than you normally would get, it will fit you much better.

reviews.name: A-Aron
reviews.reviewTitle: Great Versatile Jacket on Grand Canyon Backpacking Trip
reviews.review: Took a risk on this budget jacket as a lightweight warm layer option during a three day Grand Canyon November backpacking trip. Setting out, I wore frog toggs on top of this jacket as a water resistant layer as we descended the south rim in a “winter mix” as one ranger referred to it, a sideways barrage of freezing rain and hail. We were moving at a good pace with 40lb packs, but this jacket kept me at a perfect temperature for all days of the hike. At night, I wore it to bed in a 20-degree sleeping bag and it kept me toasty as overnight temps were near freezing. I thought it might be a single use type of product, but I continue to wear it as a primary option out and about when I want to stay warm. I’ll likely take it on another trip and will happily do so. I wouldn’t trust it in a downpour, but it can take a short, light sprinkle without issue. Zipper is higher quality than expected, hood is prefect, comes with a small stash bag.

reviews.name: Sush.Diss
reviews.review:
This is a very lightweight yet effective jacket. Keeps you warm. It has two large pockets closed with zips (no chest pocket or inner pockets). The hood does not have a zip code to tighten around the face. The main zip slider is strangely on the left. It slides easily.
But this is a very comfortable jacket. Well worth the price. I ordered one size larger as my arms are longer than what it should be. So it fits slightly loose on the chest.
Overall I like the jacket. Would recommend to others.

reviews.name: Matt Morris
reviews.review: Nice jacket. Smooth, soft, warm, comfy. I'm a 41" chest and it fits nicely around my shoulders chest and arms, but it's pretty baggy around the stomach. As there's no elastic at the bottom it's pretty loose. Will likely see if a tailor can put some elastic in it or something. Probably better off waiting to see if Trespass have anything in the Christmas sales to be honest.

reviews.name: Kiran
reviews.review:
100% Good value for money
Quality is better than what I paid.
Only one suggestion or downside, this is not adjustable, they could easily make this adjustable but still deserves 5 star
Reduced 5 to 4 stares for the following reasons:
1) Zipper is apposite side (this is not related to cost )
2) Tested on moderate chilli wind and it doesn't stand. (I understand it is a lightweight but I expect it holds for moderate cold weather )

reviews.review: The material is different. It feels like more of a poly blend than 100% cotton. I guess it's for less shrinkage after drying.

reviews.name: Ganie
reviews.review: Medium size is perfect for me (5'-8", 165lbs). The outer material is great and feels really good. The inside lining is warm enough for quick errands in this winter weather. Really nice color. Does not bleed during washing. 4-star rating is due to getting a bit deformed after the first wash. I think the outside material shrinked a little bit but the inside lining remained the same. Ironing could probably fix it but I am still not quite happy about it. But overall quality and fit is great.

reviews.name: christopher gallagher
reviews.review: very little padding in the quilting

reviews.name: hdamoca
reviews.reviewTitle: Nice but huge. I mean HUGE.
reviews.review: I bought this for my husband for Christmas. He's not a big guy but I figured it's , often clothes are way smaller than Canadian or US made clothes, so I went up 2 sizes. Wish I hadn't as the 2X is about 3 sizes too big. I sent the shirt back and reordered an Xlarge, it's still humungous, arms hanging past his fingertips. I worried that going down to a large would be too small after washing, so I kept the bigger size and hope it shrinks some. So, buy the size you'd buy in stores, don't size up or you'll be returning one too.

reviews.name: Maya B.
reviews.review: My husband requested one of these for his ritualistic campfire every Saturday night to keep warm during the Canadian Autumn days. He received it and was well pleased. It was the right fit, perfect fit even, and was very comfortable. Mind you, my husband weighs about 210 lbs and is about 5'10". It's only been one day, so I'll make sure to change my review if ever we find snags or issues with this jacket.

reviews.name: Steve Bogdon
reviews.review:
I like it. That said I read the reviews and there were lots of people mentioning this should have a zipper rather than the buttons. I ordered it thinking the buttons would be fine, I was wrong.

I still like this coat and wear it often but with the style, fit, and fabric weight.....a zipper would have been a nice feature.

I would still order it again with the buttons but would order faster with a zipper.

ORDER YOUR NORMAL SIZE

reviews.review: I cannot say this is the warmest jacket I have ever bought, but it is up there. The cotton fleece lining on this jacket is comfy and warm. I like the style of the jacket. It's not a heavy jacket per say but it is not light for it to feel useless in winter. Overall, I recommend this nice jacket. Great price for it.

Also, the jacket is nice, but their sizes run small, so order a size larger than what you normally buy.

reviews.name: Shannielle Baird
reviews.review: For this for my son. He loved it but it was too small. I'd order up a size.

reviews.name: spottedwolf
reviews.review: Jacket is great, ordered a 2x should've got a 3x, they stretch though after you wear it, so no biggie!. Keeps you nice and warm, nice fur lining.. Zippered attach hood, hood is also lined with fur, big/roomy hood that you can pull over your hat.. Alotta pockets, I'm still finding new pockets I didn't know were there!...... (I think like 7 or 8) Haven't used the draw string yet around the waist.. Really nice jacket

reviews.name: Joe Kelly
reviews.reviewTitle: Wonderfully warm, good fitting and sturdy... but...
reviews.review:
This is a crazy good value for the money... it's truly warm, very well made, and a perfect fit... but mine came with some pretty silly patches sewn on. Having to return this for that reason alone is a bummer; I truly love the coat. But, at my age, walking around sporting "Fashion" patches is out of the question. It cheapens the overall presentation of an otherwise fabulous bit of winter kit.

That being said, if you like pointing out mismatched colors or white pants after Labor Day, this just might be the coat for you.

I hope I can get a non-decorated one, pronto.

reviews.review: This jacket is a little big in the midsection but the rope tie helps out with that so all in all I like the jacket

reviews.name: pat2407
reviews.review:
My wife and I are headed from Phoenix to NYC for our first trip to see our son who moved there in April. You may imagine that, living in the desert, we don't have a wealth of cold weather clothes and I was in dire need of a good warm coat.
This looked like it would fit the bill and the price was great, so I took the plunge. Wow, am I ever pleasantly surprised!! This is a 'mid-weight' coat (think Mama bear), but once I had it on, there was no doubt it was going to do the job.
The lining is very comfortable and undoubtedly warm. The construction is sturdy and the zipper is industrial class. The warmer pockets are roomy, the hood (lined with the same 'fur' as the jacket) is very comfortable and has draw strings to make it snug in the wind. Additionally, the hood zips off if you don't happen to need it at the moment.
I can't tell yet if it's wind proof and water resistant as the manufacturer claims, but given that the rest of the description is 'on target', my guess is that it will be.
I usually wear a large, but the comments led me to believe I should step down a size which I did. They were right. I ordered a medium and there's still enough room for bundling up inside the coat.
Bottom line....a really well made, great, comfortable coat for a great price!

reviews.name: DLD322
reviews.review: I was sceptical of ordering this for husband because I didn't want to end up with a strange light grey color - something that doesn't look like ad. I was also concerned that the jacket would be flimsy like a windbreaker and/or cheap looking fabric. So glad I took a chance! The color is even better than expected, in different lighting color almost looks like a very light tan as you can see from my second photo I compared it to a medium shade of grey t-shirt. Fabric is so nice, it took 15 minutes to steam out the wrinkles from packaging, jacket is very well constructed, medium to heavy weight with the fur lining inside arms too. Love that hood is removable and cuffs are adjustable. Ordered an X- large for 190pounds, 5'10" as he has long torso and will want to wear sweatshirts underneath for extra warmth, fit is perfect! Fantastic quality, price and shipping was less than 2 days. So very happy I chose the right jacket, you won't be disappointed!

reviews.name: Patty Tee
reviews.review: I am super impressed with this jacket. At first I was skeptical since the jacket arrived in a box and the box felt super light. Upon opening the box, the jacket wasn't bulky but layered perfectly enough to keep me extremely warm. The quality and style of the jacket can be best compared to that of the Columbia brand jackets. I ordered an XXL (I'm 6'2 265 pounds) and it fits plentiful with room to layer up underneath it. (I think am XL would've fit me fine as well). Upon first two times wearing the jacket, it left a bunch of fuzzies on my shirt but after that it was fine. I love the jacket and I will be buying another color for a backup jacket

reviews.name: Keshia
reviews.review: I bought this coat for my hubby because we had to attend a funeral in Ohio this past December (2022) & we were coming from the Hampton Roads area of Virginia where the weather is considered BIPOLAR. Unfortunately, we didn't need the coat & I returned it because his uncle gave him over 5 coats in excellent condition; some still had tags on them. However, he did try it on & he liked it; but didn't need it anymore.

reviews.name: Mommyd484
reviews.review: This is great quality at an amazing price! My husband kept refusing to get a coat and I figured I would give this one a try for him! I gave it to him for his birthday and he said it was his favorite gift!

This coat was the biggest bargain of all my shopping. It's just as stated very warn and made for skiing weather. It's also so light weight you wouldn't think it could
Be so warm. The price of this coat is a fantastic buy!

reviews.review: Bought this coat for my son- he usually wears a M but we got a L so he could layer under it. It doesn’t really fit as big as we expected. But it’s a great fit. He did mention yesterday that he thinks it’s weird that the lining isn’t in the sleeves only in the body of the jacket.

reviews.review: WELL worth the value price. Very comfortable. I’m in northern wisconsin where it’s below zero right now. I wouldn’t wear this snowmobiling or snowboarding but for a daily wear jacket it’s perfect.

reviews.name: Ocean Blue
reviews.review: This is a GREAT HOODIE !!! Many of the photos in the reviews scared me with the stitching torn out of the sleeves & being marked as irregulars. It may be some retailers are pushing fake Carhartt merchandise or irregular merchandise. BUT, BUT, BUT I ordered mine from  fulfillment & carefully examined it when I received it. Mine was PERFECT !!! Even though I purchased the midweight hoodie, this is a fairly heavyweight hoodie. It seems to be sized one size different from the actual size - that is, I ordered an XL and it is almost perfectly the same size as my other XXL hoodies when I lay them overtop each other. This is EXACTLY what I expected & I ordered accordingly. So, the fit for me was PERFECT !!! (I am 5'9" & 190 lbs). Also, I know this hoodie is a 50/50 cotton blend which normally wouldn't shrink, but I washed it with warm water & medium dryer heat & it shrunk just a tiny bit, but I was really hoping it would. The material seemed to just "tighten-up" a bit after washing - just enough when it came out of the dryer it was the same size as my all cotton XXL hoodies that I washed it with. Great hoodie - I highly recommend it - I also highly recommend that you order from Amazon Fullfillment.

reviews.name: M. Dunn
reviews.review: I bought this for my husband for Christmas. He put it on and it was a good fit. As usual with Carhart, the fabric seems durable and warm. The color was as pictured. Win Win!

reviews.name: Marti Liles
reviews.review: I bought this hoodie as a Christmas gift for my hard to fit son. He loves the way it fits. Very happy with the comfort and sturdiness of this hoodie.

reviews.name: addicted2
reviews.review: My husband wear a lot of Carhartt. He has several hoodies. They wash up and look really nice even after he has worn them to work.

reviews.review: This sweatshirt is thicker than most other sweatshirts I've owned. It is very warm. I'm 6'4" 230 lbs and a Large Tall size fits great. Love it and will buy again in the future.

reviews.name: layda2
reviews.review: I like Carhartt hoodies & have a few of them, but just my luck to purchase one which is faulty, as you can see the hood doesn’t fit in the middle & eventually flaps about on my left shoulder & looks stupid, albeit my daughter thinks it looks ‘quirky’, well sorry it’s faulty!! No problem I thought, I would be able to send it back & get a refund as normal being a regular buyer on , but no, because it was shipped from Germany the seller insisted I sent it back to them which would have been a right rigmarole for me as I’m disabled & used to Amazon Prime’s service where Hermes collect items from my home if I need to send anything back to Amazon. Beware of sellers from abroad if you’re sent faulty items as you could end up with hassle & risks sending stuff back. Grrr!!!

reviews.name: Evan Daniels
reviews.review:
I personally think that the Carhartt brand is just a rip off. In no way is this garment of any special quality. The hood is a single layer of material and the drawstrings are just shoe laces (yes, with those plastic seals on the ends) I cannot think of how this is justifiable at all, in fact it's lazy. The logo on the sleave is not stitching it's that rubber glue melted onto the fabric, and to top it off I can litterally feel the edges of the pockets coming loose so I wouldnt carry anything heavy in there or put the weight of your hands inside them.
And I wouldnt get it in XL because its more like XXXXL.

reviews.name: SG
reviews.review:
Good quality sweatshirt.
Beware that this line is ‘proper’ sizing. Most clothing brands these days seem to run small and I have to wear XL chest sizes, the Large size on this is actually a tad on the large size!

reviews.name: Customer
reviews.review: Read many online reviews before buying this product. Seems to be recommended by many as a comfortable and durable hoodie. I can't say they are wrong. At this price it is definatley a long term investment, but judging by the quality it will last a long time. Great for cozy winter evenings at home or being outdoors. The fit is definatley a loose fit but not overly huge like others claim. I'm 5'7 with an athletic build and the hoodie is roomy (I bought a medium) . I would go a size down if you are looking for a more snug fit.

reviews.name: Kindle Customer
reviews.review: Bought one of these while holidaying in Canada and decided to get a spare when I arrived back in the UK and am happy to report this is an identical product not some dodgy copy. This product is made of a hard wearing material more suitable for working clothes than leisure. I have found it perfect for summer wear on a quad bike. It maybe be slightly higher price than the usual hoody but you are paying for a quality product.
