reviews.name: Texas Mimi
reviews.review:
My hubby loses jackets frequently because he's on a job site, takes them off and they disappear.
He needed (another) casual jacket. Nothing to big and heavy like a coat. Just something for cold mornings but easy to stash when the day warms up. I picked this jacket because of the cost, to be honest. $15?? I figured it would be thin and cheap but if he lost this one too, no great loss. What a surprise when it arrived. A nice mid-weight fleece, heavy duty zipper, looks good, and looks like something I paid a lot more for. He's even hanging on to this one and hasn't lost it yet! Highly recommend!11

reviews.name: DJL
reviews.reviewTitle: Cozy and warm! But sizing is kind of crazy.
reviews.review:
It's soft, relatively light, and warm. I planned to use it as an under-layer on bike rides, but now find that it is also quite comfortable to wear while puttering around indoors.

The sizing makes no sense.  displayed "large will fit you best", but large was hopelessly long and baggy. The one I'm wearing in the picture is a medium size, which is comfortable but still a little too long for use with an outer shell-type bicycling jacket. I also purchased a small in a different color (forest green), but it is slightly tight in the stomach -- and still too long!

The camo colored one (medium size) is made in Vietnam. The forest green (small size) one is from Indonesia, and seems slightly less soft.

reviews.name: Brandon
reviews.review: I’ve always been told that I’m cheap. I don’t think that’s a fair description, I just like to find the best bang for my buck… and I like to reuse paper towels lol. If you can find this fleece on sale like I did, buy it. It’s a really good find. I live in Maryland and it’s cold out right now. This fleece fits great and is keeping me warm. I’m also impressed with its comfort and zippered pockets. The pockets are really useful because they are deep pockets. So if you put your phone in one and forget to zip it up, you don’t have the feeling that anything will slip out of your pocket as you bend over to pick something up off the floor (like I do 300 times a day with my four y/o daughter)

reviews.name: WannabeTechie
reviews.reviewTitle: Could be a North Face or Patagonia
reviews.review:
I'm 5' 9" and 175 lbs. Got an XL b/c I like things a little loose. It does look a tad big on me but I would still get this over a L if you like loose clothing.

Overall... great deal! This green/black look makes it look a little more unique than the other mono colors. If you were to slap a Patagonia or North Face logo on here, no one could ever know the difference. Warm and stylish.

reviews.name: samlanus
reviews.review:
12/07/2022 reviewed again: I bought two Large at the very first time.
I am 5’7” tall.177lbs weight. It fits me perfectly. Three days after I receive them. I bought another one for myself again and two for my brothers. This  Essentials Polar fleece jacket is soft and warm. It’s thickness is medium, thick enough to keep me warm.. That’s why I would like to give 5 Stars Plus. I sewed the issue by myself.
Amazon Essentially product lines are as reliable as just like Costco’s Kirkland brand. Love it.

Large size is perfect for me. I would like to give this fleece jacket 5 stars plus. Everything about the jacket is perfect. Very resonable price,very comfortable,very good quality... But the huge pockets inside have not sewn on purpose. I don't know why. The other brand of jackets with big pockets never have the issue like this.
Don't put your cell phone inside the big pocket.

Suggestion to Amazon: Please sew the pockets completely.

reviews.name: kcinAlaska
reviews.review: I ordered one of these jackets for my husband in late summer. He loved it and wore in right into cold weather. He loved it so much that he had me order two more! He can no longer wear them in our Alaska winter weather, but since we keep our house at 68 degrees in the winter, he now wears one around the house. They are just perfect in every way - fit, comfort, warmth and, most of all: affordability. Oh, he wished me to add that they have great pockets - the outside pockets zip shut, plus there are two inner pockets. How could I forget that - he has raved about the pockets. Thank you so much.

reviews.name: Matthew Hall
reviews.review: I bought it excepting a regular jacket similar to Walmart quality but I was surprised because this  Essentials jacket seemed closer to the quality from stores in a mall. I only planned on buying one because I won't need jackets that often where I live but I believe I'll buy a 2nd one, if anything to have a spare. If anyone is on the fence about it being a basic Amazon brand, in my experience it's as good as name brand.

reviews.name: JustAnotherName12
reviews.review:
Long story short, this is the second fleece that I've bought over a couple of years. The first one that I purchased was in a regular size (not tall) and the fit was nice enough for me to wear holes in but the sleeves were a little on the short side. If I extended my arms out in front of me, the cuff of the sleeve would miss my wrist by about 4 inches. So with this purchase, I decided to account for that issue and I ordered a Tall size...now the cuff of the sleeves are like 5 inches too long. The rest of the fit is great, but the sleeve length needs to be dialed in a little better.

(FYI, I'm only 6'1" but I usually by Tall when ordering shirts)

reviews.name: ✅ SteP ✅
reviews.reviewTitle: ESSENTIAL NEL NOME MA NON DI FATTO - CALD, MORBIDO E PERFETTO PER IL FREDDO
reviews.review:
🟥 🟧 🟨 🟩 🟦 🟪 🟫🟥 🟧 🟨
🚫 TEST E CONSIDERAZIONI: 🚫
🟥 🟧 🟨 🟩 🟦 🟪 🟫🟥 🟧 🟨
Felpa acquistata a marzo 2019 e recensisco ora, maggio 2020, a distanza di oltre 1 anno, dopo averla indossata parecchio, specialmente per stare nei dintorni di casa, non essendo elegante, ma davvero molto molto calda e pratica.

Le lampo con cordino permettono di allacciarla e slacciarla al volo, sono davvero toste, sia quella per la chiusura della felpa che quelle delle tasche, sono lampo con chiusura femminile, ovvero al contrario di quella maschile, per intenderci il cursore lo farete scorrere con la mano destra anzichè con quella sinistra come sono abituati gli uomini, ma poco male è questione di abitudine.

La felpa è in pile, molto comodo, caldo e soffice, tiene davvero caldo in inverno pieno anche con venticello moderato, ovviamente se il vento è consistente l'aria passa, non essendo fatta di materiali wind stop.

Risulta discretamente traspirante, tanto da non mettersi sonovuoto quando la indossate.

Io sono alto 175cm e peso circa 72Kg, ho preso la taglia S e mi calza alla perfezione, stretta ma non troppo, perfetta di maniche. Le tasche con cerniera sono comode e profonde. Non si tratta di un capo alla moda ma adatto a coloro che lavorano e che necessitano di un indumento caldo per l'inverno da mettere magari sotto la giacca per poi poterlo utilizzare da solo in caso la giornata si scaldi leggermente.

Sono totalmente soddisfatto, nonostante le finiture non precise anzi, tutt'altro, il proprio dovere lo fa egregiamente, tiene caldo e dopo 1 anno di lavaggi praticamente settimanali è ancora soffice e perfetto, difficile pretendere di più.

🟥 🟧 🟨 🟩 🟦 🟪
🔹 CONCLUSIONI:🔹
🟥 🟧 🟨 🟩 🟦 🟪
Al prezzo di 18 euro a marzo 2019 (attualmente 19,99 euro) è difficile pretendere di più da questo genere di indumenti, non di certo adatti a situazioni eleganti ma pià che altro a situazioni pratiche in cui l'efficacia passa in secondo piano rispetto alla bellezza dell'indumento. Diversi colori disponibili ma il camouflage verde è quello che mi ha colpito di più.

Inserisco qualche foto e vi ringrazio per la lettura
Stefano

reviews.name: Arthur R.
reviews.review:
Sadly this product was disappointing considering all the positive reviews.
Firstly the zip fastener stuck and I put it down to being new or perhaps because it was on the LHS, but after numerous tries I decided it was faulty.
Also the L size fitted my arms in length and was comfortable but the body was way too small. And that's the problem with buying stuff on line. One man's large is another man's small.
It was however lightweight and what I wanted but...................

reviews.name: 🇮🇹 Schälflj 🇮🇹
reviews.reviewTitle: Apprezzabile comfort, calore e vestibilità, nonostante la economicità del capo
reviews.review:
Mi piacciono le camicie e le giacche sportive a quadrettoni e quando ho notato questa giacca in pile della serie AMAZON ESSENTIALS, con delle caratteristiche in descrittiva che erano interessanti, ho deciso di acquistarla per utilizzarla in campagna nelle nostre zone collinari, anche durante le escursioni con i miei cani.

La giacca arriva in una busta trasparente perfettamente piegata e non appena rimosso il capo ho potuto subito constatare una apprezzabile QUALITA' complessiva della giacca tutto sommato discreta, pur sempre proporzionata alla caratteristica economica del prodotto.

Considerando che siamo infatti difronte ad una GIACCA in PILE di fascia economica e piuttosto sportiva, non mi è dispiaciuta la scelta del tessuto integralmente sintetico (100% poliestere) che sebbene si percepisce subito risulta comunque sufficientemente morbida e piacevole sulla pelle.

Apprezzabile ho trovato anche il suo CONFEZIONAMENTO sufficientemente curato ed attento ai particolari, come entrambe le TASCHE esterne con CHIUSURA a CERNIERA, la ampia TASCA INTERNA aperta e l’ELASTICO ai POLSINI, senza trascurare la CERNIERA LAMPO FRONTALE, che però presenta l’unico “difetto” di essere al contrario, ovvero al femminile, scelta che ammetto non ho compreso e che in alcune circostanze mi procura qualche rallentamento nella chiusura.

A proposito della CERNIERA LAMPO, non si tratta di una marca nota YKK come indicato in alcune recensioni, ma in questa colorazione rosso-bisonte è una più economica che però svolge egregiamente il suo compito, con innesti sufficientemente precisi e scorrimenti fluidi in apertura come in chiusura, peccato solo per il montaggio al contrario a cui molti dovranno abituarsi.

Mi è piaciuta invece la tonalità del TESSUTO a QUADRETTONI rosso/blu dallo stile vagamente nord americano, con un PESO medio ed una sufficiente morbidezza, che mi ha piacevolmente sorpreso per il CALORE che garantisce, perfetto per la stagione fredda in arrivo.

Considerando inoltre la economicità di questo pile, trovo comunque gradevole il confezionamento della giacca, senza evidenti difetti e con quel colletto alto chiudibile con la cerniera lampo fin sotto il mento, per una linea complessiva piacevole che gli conferisce una certa personalità e carattere.

Il TAGLIO è ovviamente sportivo ed indovinando la propria TAGLIA corretta, la VESTIBILITA' risulta comunque discreta.
Neppure le MANICHE le ho trovate abbondanti in lunghezza come a volte accade ed avendo seguito le indicazioni in descrittiva ho scelto correttamente la M.
Si tratta di una MISURA che per me che normalmente indosso giacche taglia 48 è risultata corretta, senza abbondanza ma una apprezzabile comodità, che mi permette di vestire il PILE con sotto anche una camicia, una polo o comunque un ulteriore capo.

Dopo aver considerato attentamente le misure indicate in descrittiva, come da altri evidenziato suggerisco di valutare di acquistare una TAGLIA IN MENO a quella che normalmente si è abituati a vestire, si tratta infatti di un capo che veste largo e non ho neppure riscontrato la vita stretta come segnalata nelle descrizioni.

Nel cercare di offrire dei riferimenti i più precisi possibili in relazione alle MISURE della TAGLIA M da me ordinata, se vado a misurare la giacca a riposo su un appendiabiti, i valori che posso confermare sono:
TORACE (solo frontale) 54.5 cm, SPALLE 43 cm, VITA (solo frontale) 52 cm, MANICA 65 cm da fine spalla a polsino.

La giacca si indossare bene, non lega, non vincola nei movimenti, consentendo di vestire sotto ancora un ulteriore capo non troppo aderente come una camicia.
Il capo infatti non stringe ne a vita come neppure sulle spalla e garantisce quel calore che potrà migliorare il comfort quotidiano durante i primi abbassamenti di temperature di fine autunno - inizio inverno, pur non essendo eccessivamente spesso.

Le CUCITURE e quindi il confezionamento del tessuto, risultano discrete e sempre in linea con la tipologia sportiva/economica del capo, un pile che comunque non stona abbinato ad un paio di pantaloni sportivi, anche dei semplici jeans, per una abbigliamento molto informale e pratico che trovo apprezzabile nella nostra zona collinare di campagna, ma anche da utilizzare semplicemente in giardino o durante le escursioni con i nostri cani.

Nel complesso mi sento quindi di promuovere questa giacca della serie AMAZON ESSENTIALS, per le caratteristiche complessive del capo, acquistato a fine ottobre 2022 al PREZZO di 12.45 euro nella taglia M color ROSSO BISONTE, un costo che ritengo equilibrato.
L'ultima verifica che andrà fatta è la reazione del tessuto dopo i primi lavaggi, ma è probabile che valuterò di acquistare altre colorazioni più classiche.

In quanto alla spedizione e consegna da parte di , sono state anche in questa circostanza efficienti e puntuali grazie al servizio Prime.
Mi auguro che questa recensione possa essere di aiuto e se avete dubbi o quesiti non esitate a chiedere.

reviews.name: Mr D
reviews.review:
This may not be the best fleece jacket you will ever own, but it could well be the best value for money. Fleece is a fairly basic material that is reasonably warm, highly breathable and fairly light weight, compared to say wool. However it offers almost no protection against wind or rain so is best suited to being worn as a mid layer.
This jacket offers almost no frills e.g. no shoulder or elbow reinforced patches, no 2 way zip and not even a hem cord with cord locks. However most of these features merely add weight and cost and provide very little benefit in the real world.
Ultimately what really matters are decent materials, good quality construction and accurate sizing and happily this jacket is very good when it comes to these criteria.
Overall this jacket provides good warmth, from a mid weight material, being around twice the weight of a micro fleece fabric. It fits me very well and the slightly elasticated cuffs and hem are sufficient to keep out any draughts. There are two hand warming outer pockets with zips and additionally 2 large inside “poacher” pockets big enough for a Ordnance Survey map but much more likely to be used for a hat or light weight windproof shirt/waterproof smock. The poacher pockets also provide a useful double layer of insulation, like wise the collar also has double thickness of material
If worn under a Goretex type jacket you may miraculously find that the jacket suddenly becomes far less leak prone. This is because around 99% of the moisture inside the jacket is not in fact rain coming in, but sweat that cannot get out, but can be managed very effectively by the fleece.

reviews.name: B.M.
reviews.review: Other reviewers have complained about the zip on “wrong” side, but a more serious problem is that the 2 very useful inside pockets have slit holes in the bottom (maybe to allow MP3 headphones to be threaded through?) which makes them useless for keys, coins, smaller phones (my iPhone SE goes straight through). So you need an obliging lady with needle and thread to fix this first before you lose your stuff. Otherwise, an OK fleece, with two front zip pockets, rather loose fit on the chest, but good value for money.

title: Levi's Men's Trucker Jacket
description: The original jean jacket since 1967. A symbol of self-expression for decades, and a great starting point for customization. Gets better over time from natural wear with fading, stains and holes.

reviews.name: johnnyjohnny
reviews.review:
so, like, who hasn't had one of these Levi's trucker jackets, and doesn't know how great they are. just amazing.
but for years now i've been seeing thick denim work or Western shirts, which i bought, but started thinking how great one of these jackets would look used as a shirt. especially one of the already distressed ones. so after about 5 years of thinking this, i got one just for that purpose.
i normally wear an XL in these jackets when using them as a jacket, but as a shirt i went down a size and it's perfect...better fitting than most of my shirts prior to washing/shrinking them. i got the distressed black, so it's a bit more 'shirt'like. i have to say if anyone is considering doing this i highly recommend it. it does give you a bit of the Elvis '68 Special look, which is never a bad thing, except of course this is not leather. but it does have the thickness and so it's very similar to that look. i wear mine a la The Kind, with the collar turned up, and like how the bottom sits just below the beltline on my...you guessed it, Levi's bootcut jeans.
so, you may already know how cool these jax are as jax, but not you can wear them all the time, even when no jacket is needed....as a shirt. one of the pleasures in life.

reviews.name: Drew Rummel
reviews.reviewTitle: Exactly how a jean jacket is supposed to be
reviews.review: Love it. Blast from the past. I grew up wearing these in the 80s. They're still pretty much the typical classic jean jacket and are exactly how they are supposed to be. Fit and feel exactly as they should. Unless you're a youngster or just have unrealistic expectations theres nothing to complain about with these. They are what they are.

reviews.name: RGB
reviews.review: 50 years ago levi trucker jackets were the very best in style, material and craftsmanship. Today it still is. I have two jackets. 1 sized to wear over sweaters etc and another over Ts and lightweight shirts. I highly recommend. I'm 69 yo and could change brands but the others are just not like a Levi. My sizes are 3x & 2x. The 100% cotton version is only version for me. Not stretchy. My chosen sizes are room enough and movement is zero problems. Final thought, the cotton weight is medium to light heavy. Perfect feel for durability proven wear for work or just because you look so good in an authentic Levi trucker jacket.

reviews.name: Mattea Williams
reviews.review:
I wanted a normal length Jean jacket, and it’s hard to find when you are a taller female. I actually have a female Levi’s trucker jacket and it looks cropped on me. Apparently it still looks good but it’s not what I was going for. BUT THIS is perfect. It’s slightly oversized on me but but loose enough I can comfortably wear a hoody under it. I’m ecstatic. This also appears to be authentic Levi’s, if anyone is worried about getting knock offs off . I will made and comfortable.

Just in case it doesn’t show for some reason, I got a large. 5’10 female approximately 200lbs, fit.

reviews.name: Chloe
reviews.review: I got this as a gift for my bf and he loves it, I looks great on him. I recommend

reviews.name: L. Underwood
reviews.review: Fit as I had hoped it would for my husband who wears XXL shirts. He is happy enough with this jacket to replace his well worn old one.

reviews.name: W Harvey
reviews.review: I was really worried about ordering this jacket because of all the reviews, but this jacket is perfect. The fit is perfect (you don’t have order a size up) and the jacket looks great! Just like the one I had in high school!

reviews.name: Shawny Alan
reviews.reviewTitle: Good wear, comfortable and cant beat the price
reviews.review:
Very comfortable fits just right, I played it safe and picked Large, I would normally pick Medium but I want extra room in case I want to layer shirts or t-shirt. I like the hoodie style and the arms have that sweatshirt stretch feel.

-Just in case go a size up if you think jacket will be tight, For reference I compared it to my normal levi's medium denim, and this hoodie version feels much more comfortable, from eyeing both they look the same size, minus the hood on this one I bought.

I am 5'6 male with medium build.

tag says made in china

no issues with delivery

I already know which levi's i'll buy next.

reviews.name: Robert Evans
reviews.review:
Absolutely love this jacket. The fit is as expected and has two deep inside pockets.
The denim is rigid and of very high quality - unfortunately rigid 501 jeans in the UK are titled classic/vintage and cost upwards of £130.00. I therefore order mind direct from the USA - Rocky Mountain Connection in Colorado offer excellent service.

reviews.review: Too big!

reviews.name: mike
reviews.review:
As expected from Levi a great looking hybrid that attracts attention and comments
fantastic idea

reviews.review: Happy with the jacket Bot Happy to have to pay import duty of 25%!!!

reviews.name: Customer
reviews.review: Exactly what I wanted

reviews.name: Karen
reviews.review: Mostly purchase Under Armor, Banana Republic and JCrew, husband is very happy with this jacket. Looks good and seems to be good quality. 88

reviews.name: TiredMama
reviews.review: Got this for my brother as a gift. He says it’s the best jacket he’s ever had. Fabric is thick and quality. Fit and shape are flattering. Plenty of pockets.

Then I found that wearing multiple layers of a variety of thicknesses was more than satisfactory to keep me warm. The jacket is too bulky to wear under a life jacket. I'm now wearing it as a midweight good looking jacket instead...not for paddling.

reviews.name: Cedric R. Brown
reviews.review: This jacket has all of the qualities that I wanted in a jacket. It stops water and the wind. It is light enough were I feel very comfortable wearing it. I like it and you will too.

reviews.name: Customer

reviews.name: Lawrence J. Laffer

reviews.name: Wendy Ruano
reviews.review: Es muy cómoda y talla perfecto. Su material es suave y resistente. Es algo pesada.

reviews.name: JavaInMyCup
reviews.review:
Pros:
1) This jacket is great at trapping your body heat! Great for Fall and Winter.
2) Looks good
3) Fits
4) Good casual wear for regular outings
5) Good at blocking wind.

Cons:
1) The textile used to make the zippers are indeed delicate. Will tear if you're brutish with it otherwise it's okay. It's about 1 tier below regular zippers we're all used to.
2) Can tear if you're wearing this jacket for high activity outings like skiing etc.
3) The first few minutes after donning the jacket and stepping outside may be a bit chilly (winter season) until you warm it up with your body heat. Like I said it's great at trapping heat.

Pro tip: After measuring the size to fit; buy 1 size larger. I had to return my first jacket b/c it fits too damn well; exposing the shape of my beer belly. My second one was 1 size larger (still fits) and that is where I gave it my 5 stars. And no you don't see my tummy.

reviews.name: Natnat
reviews.reviewTitle: Perfect gift for my frequent skier, live in mountain's brother.
reviews.review: I bought is as a Christmas gift. My sister and brother in law live in the Sierras and are on the slopes every chance they get. I was concerned about the size (as I always am). He loved it! It fit perfectly as stated and has a sleek look. It is also lined and has pockets and waterproof. Tested on the slopes and lives up as described. I got it at a good price. In fact, I ordered a womens for my sister.

reviews.name: MattyTao
reviews.reviewTitle: Did not expect how good this ski jacket was 😂
reviews.review: Loved how warm it was! I brought this to Vancouver with me while it was snowing and it has kept me warm the WHOLE TIME. Def something I will keep on me for a while and don’t have plans to return this at all. Espeically for such a good deal from a brand I didn’t know of. I would highly recommend it again and again for someone lookin for a ski jacket without hurting to much in the bank. They’re an honest brand and I would recommend again!

reviews.name: Max
reviews.reviewTitle: Looks Great and Feels Nice on the Inside
reviews.review: I purchased this mainly as a snowboarding jacket because of the waterproofing abilities and the great deal! I've been eyeballing this jacket for a while and when I saw it go on sale I pulled the trigger and I'm glad I did. It's nice and cozy on the inside and the outside performs as intended in the snow/cold. This will definitely be used off the slopes as well

reviews.name: Enid
reviews.review: These look great and fit perfectly. My son used these for a ski trip to Canada and was in love. These kept him very warm and were lightweight enough for him to do many activities. Totally waterproof. He wore these with thermals and snow bibs did not need anything else. It was around 17F.

reviews.name: Laura G
reviews.review: I bought this for my husband. He went deep sea fishing and his last waterproof jacket was not so waterproof. This one fit great, kept him warm and dry, and is super easy to clean. Plus he can use it for snow trips too. Would recommend.

reviews.name: Nelda R.
reviews.review: This jacket has been the best jacket I have ever worn. I did not feel the cold going to my chest nor anywhere on my torso area on a 10 degrees weather. It was windy as well and I did not feel any of it. I had two shirts on and these jacket. I bought two more for my kids.

reviews.name: Customer
reviews.review: Used for my recent travel to Colorado. Use while exploring the Rocky Mountains with temperatures of -1*F and it did the job. I use a long sleeve shirt under it, and i never had a problem with te temperature. Warm enough also light. Very good product. I recomend it.

reviews.name: Owen
reviews.reviewTitle: Zip broke within 2 days of wear
reviews.review: This was bought for my son's skiing trip and the side pocket zip broke on day 2. I am now struggling to find out how I can return this as it was bought more than 30 days ago, but believe I should be able to return for a full refund. Anyone know who to contact?

reviews.name: Philippe Lamontagne
reviews.review:
definitly surprised at the quality

the people who complain about the pocket sippers must be gorillas...

very nice quality for the price

been abusing it in quebec winter ( ice fishing , fat biking, ski etc ) and i dont have anything negative to say

its light and thin so perfect for winter sports but also very warm

very happy
the sizing was perfect. i am 5’8 very wide shoulders and just like all my other jackets i went for XL and its perfect fit

reviews.name: Dana Bellagamba
reviews.review: This jacket fits great. It looks great and is warm. Very good quality and at a great price point. The sizing chart is true to size. My husband is 6’1 and weighs 230lbs. The XL fits perfectly.

reviews.name: Certified reviews
reviews.review:
I am giving it two stars as I liked the color, style, and vacuum packing of the jacket. Apart from it, there was nothing good about it. The size is not as per the chart. It is oversized, It is not warm at all. maybe for +8 C, it is ok. The inner lining of the jacket was defective in terms of threading and a big tear on the side.

It was not for me. Not satisfied with the product as per the price of it

reviews.name: darren tierney
reviews.review:
After looking on  for a couple hours at jackets, I was frustrated with the so so reviews. I went into an Atmosphere store and looked at jackets only to be shocked by seeing $300 price tags… in the clearance section. So I gave Amazon another go and landed on this jacket.

I’ve been really happy with it. It’s warm. Size was great (XL for a 6’6” 220lb guy). I’m not sure how long it will last but so far this winter I’ve worn it a lot and there’s no big signs of wear or breaking. Really happy with this jacket considering it’s price and it’s competitors prices.

reviews.name: M. Elaine Murphy
reviews.review: My husband, who got this for Christmas this year, has hardly taken it off since he got it.

reviews.name: Pamela Yarborough
reviews.review: Bought this for my husband and he loves it. I love it on him, too. It fits well and is lightweight and comfortable.

reviews.name: Joel Ostmo
reviews.review: I usually wear a large but reviews said to go up a size. Just get the size you normally wear. Other than that’s it’s a very nice coat.

reviews.name: cindy s
reviews.review: She loves it, doesn't want to take it off

reviews.name: Winters Run
reviews.reviewTitle: Good Insulator on Those Frosty Mornings
reviews.review: Perfect before the hard winds and sub-zero temps of winter set in. Finally a quilted flannel shirt that fits well and keeps you warm before its time to break out the heavy coats. Good quality and workmanship.

reviews.name: Dave Reksnis
reviews.review: It’s a great hoodie! Fits good and is comfortable! We are happy with it .

reviews.name: Bradford Christian
reviews.reviewTitle: I'm impressed with it. It's warm.
reviews.review:
Quality is great. Inner lining is great. Color is great (I got blue).

It fits a little large on me. Some reviews said it fit a bit small. (Especially on the other Wrangler one like this with no hood)... I was worried I was going to have to get an XL. I got a large and it's a bit huge on me. No worries because I'm currently bulking up. (I'm 6ft tall and 210lbs) However, it makes me wonder how much shrinking I can expect from washing it. Normally I'm about 170 lbs and probably would've still taken a chance on Large... but apparently I would've been swimming in it. Even as it stands, it makes me look like I'm almost 300lbs because it's quite big.

I also wondered (based on another review) if the color would be faded... but the blue is nice and vibrant.

It's a LOT more like a jacket than a regular hoodie. Partly due to the sort of quilted inner lining, partly due to how big and warm and cozy it is I guess. If it's around 0 degrees I can get away with just this plus t-shirt under, no REAL winter jacket/coat.

Like some other options out there, the design for this one could've probably benefited from an inner zipper and then the buttons... and of course some dudes would prefer snaps instead of buttons.

Lady loves it. I'm impressed with it. It's warm. Pockets are useful.

reviews.name: Merardo Garcia Gonzalez
reviews.reviewTitle: Chamarra Ligera, amplia y muy cálida.
reviews.review:
Ligera, Caliente, Ideal para utilizar por debajo de la misma algún suéter, playera o similar, buena manufactura, botones resistentes y bien fijos, ojales de buen tamaño, bolsas amplias, gorro muy calientito y amplio.

Es la primer prenda de esta marca que compro y quede muy satisfecho con mi compra, me gustó su color y lo ligera y abrigadora que resulta ser.

En mi caso soy talla XL, me gusta andar holgado y no muy justo de talla, de igual forma pudiera haber sido la talla L pero no me quejo, en realidad muy satisfecho con la calidad del producto en relación a su costo, entrega en 1 solo día y si problema.

Ampliamente recomendable.

reviews.name: Telnets
reviews.review: Id never wear this as a "shirt".. but as a light spring/fall jacket i would. Its got a quilted material liner, and the material is decently thick. Its heavier then a shirt, but lighter then a jacket.. It also fits slightly large, maybe by an inch more then i expected, but thats okay if wearing a shirt under it.

reviews.name: Eric the great
reviews.reviewTitle: Was as expected. Happy for the price.
reviews.review:
I would describe this as a light outer jacket. Costco sells a similar product if you’ve ever seen it you should know what to expect here. Fit me well, i sized myself as I would usually for clothing and went for a small. I’m male 5’5 and 130lbs I’m happy with how it fits.

The hood I would say is it’s weak point. Kind of an odd shape and the material was a little light there. Nice that is had that feature at all though honestly. I got this to wear at work and in that environment it won’t last forever (nothing would) and I would buy it again.

reviews.name: Bruce Yamamoto
reviews.review:
It’s lightweight and comfortable to wear during spring, fall or around the house. I usually wear XL but I bought 2XL because I thought it would shrink after I washed it.

It didn’t shrink as much as I expected and it’s still about the same size, but the hood is HUGE. It’s so big that I can easily wear it over my bike helmet. LOL

reviews.name: Customer
reviews.reviewTitle: Good fleece with only a couple fo quirks
reviews.review:
I bought one to try as I wear allot of this style outerwear and my current inventory is getting fairly old/worn. I'd say fit and finish is excellent on the jacket received. It's warm, blocks wind well and fit true to sizing for the most part (I ordered XL as I usually wear). the extra pockets take some getting used to but do come in handy.
I only have two minor grips:
1) The zipper pull is on the left side as is common with woman's clothing. I knew this going in as it's clearly advertised but it doesn't make it any less annoying every time I put the garment on/off.
2) The arms are 2-3' too long and I believe they are designed that way given the have thumb slots so you can wear them down over your hands somewhat. (This also seems like a woman's clothing feature.) It's not bad but it is noticeable.
All in all, I had hoped to order a couple of more of these to keep around but those two minor issues will keep me shopping for another brand.

reviews.name: todd
reviews.review:
I was pleasantly surprised buy the material weight. Good heavy dense fleece. It fit ok, good for spring fall. It's not a winter jacket (unless you live somewhere where it doesn't get cold). No surprise there.

Now for the rest:
Arms are long
The thumb hole things are really small, not really useful... but are they really anyway?
Zipper on the left side?
Hood..not sure what the intent was but its big, and odd shaped, like it was supposed to fit over helmet or something.
I don't understand the visor feature, it's floppy, and makes a great sail that pulls the hood back when it's windy.

I don't hate it, I bought it for an inner layer so it works good for that. If You're looking for something marginal, at a decent price this is it.
If you want some great quality with great features..maybe this isn't it

reviews.name: Richard A Lefler
reviews.review: This is my favorite buy of 2022! I love this product, just got it but I could not be happier! This is warm and comfortable and perfect for chilly early mornings! Love the deep front pockets, the sleeve pockets and the pocket in the back! For the original price this is a major win! For the discounted price, I’ll be stealing another one in a different color! If you’re considering this and need something warmer than an average fleece, this is it! Runs, slightly big in medium but this is my new go to fleece!

reviews.name: Kelsey Quinn
reviews.review: I purchased this as a gift for my son and it looked good to me on him, but he felt it was too snug. I did agree that the sleeves were a bit short. He actually wanted to go two sizes up, which we did and he likes the loose fit but I think it’s too big. So I would say go one size up. He really likes it and it is a good looking jacket.

reviews.name: Dennis
reviews.review: Just got mine in after a long wait. Everything seems well made, the jacket is very comfortable. Am very dissapointed that I need to return mine,I ordered a 2 XL and it fits like a 3 XL. Be sure to order one size under you normal size. The jackets are 100% polyester so they will not shrink upon washing

reviews.name: Chris Casey
reviews.review: Solid product for price. Thought it would be a little heavier but it is warm. It is better than what some departments stores sell at double the price. Good work coat.

reviews.name: JeffinNM
reviews.review: Gave one to each of my sons for Christmas. They liked all the pockets, style, and material. I was expecting a loose fit, but the jackets run a bit small on both of them. Still deciding whether to keep or order a larger size.

reviews.name: JB
reviews.review: The jacket is warm and comfortable. I don`t like the left side zip. It`s not a deal breaker though, just take some getting use to. I would recommend.

reviews.name: Customer
reviews.review: Total fraud, this is a liner from a 3 in 1 system, really thin and pockets are in useless places. Don’t waste your time or money on this, it’s worth about $2 maximum.

reviews.name: Customer
reviews.review: It fits well an anatomically correct man, but if your head is small, have narrow shoulders and short arms it's probably not for you. I like the design, the arm pockets have room for a pack of smokes, lighter, phone, compass etc. The back pocket can hold an emergency kit or whatever. It provides good head, cheek and neck protection. Thick and warm enough on chilly days.

reviews.name: dave raymond paquette
reviews.reviewTitle: Cut is not designed for North Americans
reviews.review: The size is far to be small to be a size of XXL. The back is ok but the arms are tiny on these. Arms cut like they were from a large not for an XXL.

reviews.name: Fernando
reviews.review: Love how warm it keeps you, wearing it currently for work but I, personally overheat so quickly in this that I have to strip it off. Fantastic overall, will probably order another colour for casual wear. Large fits like an XL so if you want a tighter fit, step down a size.

reviews.name: Kindle Customer
reviews.review: Nice jacket. Fleece is a reasonable weight. Fit is a bit small for the size. If you like close fir, size works out. Only issue is no hood string to close up in wind. Easy fix as the channel is already in the hood, so some paracord and a couple of spring stays (eclipses?) and alls well.

reviews.name: Chadwick Mitchell
reviews.review: fits like a glove am probably gonna buy another one in a different color

reviews.name: DCsox721

I'm 6'1 155 pounds and got a medium, what I usually get for stuff. The height, shoulder width, and arm length were all perfect. The chest and arm widths were bulkier than I would have liked. Being skinny, it is what it is. I wish slim fit was an option. The hemming on sleeves and waist are nice though so it fits well there.

The pockets and zippers and buttons give the jacket a nice personality which I why I picked this one to begin with. The inside is very comfortable and will you keep you warm for anything but the coldest weather.

The inside jacket pockets will fit your phone at then some. The outside chest area pockets can fit a phone width wise, but it will stick out an inch or so.

reviews.name: Andres Melgar
reviews.review: Bonita pero se la tuve que regalar a mi hermano porque me quedó grande

reviews.name: David
reviews.review: I never bought clothes online but this turned out to be homerun. It fits perfectly. I am 5'8 with an average build 160lbs, and purchased the Medium. The collar portion can be laid flat or popped a little just like in the picture. It has a militaristic look, which I like. reviews.name: eric
reviews.reviewTitle: Has multiple heat zones, good construction, fits small
reviews.review:
I was fortunate enough to read a couple other reviews which hinted at this jacket running a bit smaller so I ordered an XL when I normally wear a size Large. That was a good move because it fits me perfectly. This jacket looks like a normal winter coat except for the space age LED logo on the left breast area. the LEDs can be turned off but they are useful at first to see what zones are active and what their setting is. There's a setting for front, back, arms, and the neck/hood area, all individually controllable with different temperature settings.

The heat works great and stays on for a while then turns itself off automatically and you stay warm since the heat stays trapped inside the jacket. This is probably going to offend someone but I get the feeling that this jacket is made more for mild climates where people think they are cold but it's actually like 50 degrees outside. Where I live in the mountains, it's extremely cold in the winter which presents a problem when using a jacket like this. I've noticed when wearing several layers, which is what you do when it's very cold, you don't always feel the warmth of this jacket since the other layers are keeping the heat out as much as it keeps the cold from you as well. So this works best when worn with something thin like a T shirt and maybe a thin sweatshirt underneath. That said, it's still useful with layers, but you won't notice the heat as much.

The jacket is powered by what appears to be a standard 5V USB power bank that is included and fits perfectly in the little pouch built into the jacket. I tested another one I had and it works fine, so if the original power bank fails, it's nice to know the jacket isn't completely useless. I've been using this jacket for about a month now and the battery pack works fine. I've had to charge it about every 3 times I wear it for extended periods, it's easy to remove and charge, just like any other USB power pack.

I did want to mention that the packaging for this jacket is very nice, and it looks and feels like a high quality product. The construction is good and aside from the size being off, I really don't have any complaints about it. The various heat zones is a great feature and is especially useful if you find that one part of your body is colder than the others, so you aren't burning up in one area and cold in another. It's a nice jacket and I've been using it on medium cold days but to be honest, I'm still using my Patagonia jacket with a couple other layers when it's below 0 and I've been just fine with that. I do like the novelty of this heated jacket and I find myself wanting to wear it more than I was expecting when I first tried it on.

reviews.name: David Bilney
reviews.review: Took a while to arrive but a great fit

reviews.name: Coral Grimes
reviews.review:
One of the frustrating things about being an active plus-size woman, particularly one that carries a substantial amount of weight in the chest or belly, is the near-total lack of high-quality technical gear available for purchase. Most companies assume that if you’re overweight, you must not go outside in inclement weather, and most certainly not to *gasp* exercise! As many plus-size people out there know, many of us do both, and many of us are committed to improving or restoring our health, be it from weight-gain due serious injury or illness, or from simply choosing a healthier path in life. (Both happen to apply in my case.)

The problem as a woman, however, is the extremely limited range of plus sizes in high-quality technical gear. Columbia is one of the only brands to have plus-sizes at all, but even theirs only go up to a 3X for women. And, unfortunately, their 3X is more like a 1X-2X in other plus-size brands like Penningtons. That leaves women over 240 lbs out in the cold (literally and figuratively).

However, plus-size women, there is hope. I ordered this Columbia men’s plus-size jacket in 4X and it was the equivalent of a women’s 4X at Penningtons. Just as important (and rather surprising): the sleeves are not excessively long like most men’s jackets. They’re only slightly too long for my arms (about an inch) which is easily dealt with by using the Velcro straps.

The rest of the jacket is equally well-proportioned. While it doesn’t hug the hips in a feminine way, it’s not bulky or pouchy in other areas, and easily passes as a unisex or women’s jacket in my opinion.

As expected from Columbia, the jacket materials are superb. The jacket is very lightweight, waterproof, breathable, and exceptionally comfortable. It’s infinitely more comfortable and higher-quality than any of the plus-size department store-brands I tried, and it’s about 40% less expensive.

Highly recommend to anyone who is plus-size and desires excellent outdoor gear.

The 2xl did fit but I felt it was big. When I grabbed the jacket in the middle of my chest and pulled out there was 5 to 6 inches of extra room. The sleaves felt really baggy and it was barely at waist height.

If your unsure about sizing order both and see. The 1xl b&t was slimmer fitting while being a little longer as I'm 6'.
The 2xl felt too big and boxy. More suited for a bigger dude who's sorter then myself.

reviews.name: Brandon
reviews.review:
So to start, I was looking for a winter/fall
Jacket that would be used on milder weather days during the winter and late fall months ( around +5C to -10C). I already have a proper winter jacket but it dosent make sense to wear a jacket that’s rated up to -30C on days where it’s -5C outside as it would be overkill in my opinion. I saw great reviews on YouTube and  for Carhartt and at first I bought an XXL because I wanted a little extra room (I’m a size XL) to be able to layer up if necessary however this jacket (and it does NOT mentioned on the tag in the pictures put up on Amazon) was a “Loose Fit”! As a result, the jacket felt more like a 3XL or 4XL. I ended up exchanging it for an XL “Loose fit” which fit more like a XXL because I wanted the extra room but I’m certain that if I got a large it would have been form fitting. All in all, I love it! It’s a little stiff but as it breaks in, I’m sure this thing will feel more like a sweater than a jacket which is dangerous because I’ll run the risk of wearing it all the time haha. Otherwise it’s a good buy in my opinion but I don’t think that it will be as protecting against the cold on a day where it’s -30C outside.

reviews.name: Customer
reviews.review: This is my first Carhartt jacket and now I understand the popularity. This is built with an almost mythical quality I have not seen since vintage gems like a 50’s Harris Tweed. Mind you this is no fancy-mans jacket. Tough as nails you actually feel protected. The zipper is HEAVY duty. I’m 5’10” 170 lbs and the medium is perfect. It is loose as said but I wear a sweater. Temps right now are about -15c/ 5F. The hood seems built for wearing a hat or helmet under for sure—it’s shallower then I like but it warm and cozy. It’s pretty much everything people say it is, and it’s made in the USA which is great by me being Canadian. If you think you don’t want one, you are just wrong! I think it’s very well priced for the quality.

reviews.name: Mathieu
reviews.review:
Veste très confortable, relativement chaude, je peux la porter seule jusqu'a des températures avoisinant les -5 celcius, autrement je mets un cotton ouatté en dessous et j'ai été confortable jusqu'aux -25C.
Détail important, la veste servait à aller pelter et aller au travail, donc mon temps à l'extérieur sans activitée était limité, je ne l'ai pas porté pour de longues heures.
Le tissus est très résistant.
Je porte normalement des chanfails 5xl, j'ai fait de même pour la veste malgré les recommendations de prendre une taille plus petit. En terme de longueur de la veste et des manches le "fit" est parfait, en terme de taille, tour de taille, diamètre des bras, c'est un peu grand, mais me permet facilement de porter une à deux couches additionnelles en dessous me permettant d'affronter les températures plus basses sans problèmes.

Les 2 seuls points négatif que j'ai pu noter
1-) manque de souplesse dans le capuchon, il tiens vraiment haut sur les épaules et me gêne la vue en conduisant
2-) le matériel utilisé bien que résistant attire les poils et cheveux comme un aimant, je dois passer la brosse tout les jours dessus avant de quitter. J'ai 2 chats et le manteau est rangé sur des crochets aux murs.

Autrement superbe produit, j'espère qu'il me durera des années car je l'adore.

reviews.name: Devo
reviews.review: I usually get a extra large but I purchased a large and fits perfectly. I’m 5foot8 inch tall and 250 pounds with a slight beer belly. Seems to be the real deal and not a fake. Label says made in the USA. I paid 135 Canadian. With is a great deal. Better than paying 205 at marks for the exact same jacket.

title: Hanes Men's Hoodie, EcoSmart Fleece Zip-Front Hooded Sweatshirt, Cotton-Blend Fleece Hooded Sweatshirt, Mid-Weight Zip-Up
description: Your comfort and your values can go hand-in-hand when you choose a zip-front hooded sweatshirt you can feel good about buying and feel good about wearing. Hanes® EcoSmart® fleece is your new go-to wardrobe staple. Soft and plush, this cozy zip-up fleece hoodie is made of mid-weight cotton/poly fleece with up to 5% of the poly fibers. The fleece in this classic zip-front hooded jacket is super soft and thick, and made to keep its warm, cozy feel. And it will hold its shape thanks to ribbed cuffs and hem. Double-needle stitching at the neck and armhole seams further enhance quality and sturdiness. In classic hoodie style, there's a split kangaroo pocket and a dyed-to-match drawstring at the hood. Here's a soft, warm, fleece zip-up hooded sweatshirt to wear well and with pride.

reviews.name: Customer
reviews.review: I bought this as a last-minute costume for work (Damien from Mean Girls) I thought it would sit in my closet because why would I need a baby blue zip-up hoodie? I love it, it's so comfortable I wear it at home all the time, I even wore it to work today. It's very lightweight but still warm when the heater is barely on. Still pretty soft, too. It's just enough to keep me content without making me feel like I am overheating.

reviews.name: RyRyRooRoo
reviews.reviewTitle: Purchased for my 12 year old daughter to be worn with school uniform 👍🏼
reviews.review: My daughter loves her jacket! (Matches well with school uniform.) It is warm and fits her well. My daughter is a little over 100 pounds, and Men’s Small fits….. which tells me these run smaller. That is the only reason I am giving 4 stars. Otherwise quality is really good! Recommended, but order up in size.

reviews.name: Thomas Everett Haynes
reviews.review: I love this, but the pockets are so bad. Everything falls out of them. Phone, wallet, small child, everything. I'm going to sew in my own velcro, button, or flap. Serious problem.

reviews.name: Audrey
reviews.review: I definitely love this jacket! It’s perfect for lounging around the house or running errands. It’s very cute and simple, and can match with any outfit! I’d highly recommend!

reviews.name: Tom
reviews.reviewTitle: Very warm for light weight hoodie
reviews.review: This hoodie is surprisingly warm for a lightweight hoodie. I wasn’t in love with the zipper and the fact that the flannel interior lining shed on my shirt. So I sent it back it’s really an OK product. It just wasn’t what I was looking for, a little light on quality.

reviews.name: ebelyn suquilema
reviews.reviewTitle: itchy but can’t complain for the price
reviews.review: i was so happy to order it for my boyfriend, but it was itchy. that’s the only problem and i hope a wash in the laundry will fix that. it’s alright though!

reviews.name: Jae
reviews.review: This is a perfect jacket. The inside is soft, and it fits as expected (some extra room, but not too baggy or oversized). It's not so light that I'm freezing, but also not so heavy that I'm hot. Would recommend.

reviews.name: Gladys
reviews.reviewTitle: Soft and cozy. Looks great not sloppy
reviews.review:
Nice length. I ordered a size up so it fits loos
I am a size 18 and I ordered a XXL. It fits more like a jacket. Does not shrink

reviews.name: Zena
reviews.review:
i first ordered the green (in size M), I liked it so much I ordered the grey (i ordered XL to get the oversized brandy look). Regular hoodie- not super thick but not too thin, good quality and & overall good for the price. didn’t shrink for me in the dryer or pill up

I am 5’8” (173 cm) and 130 pounds for reference.

reviews.name: Darvik
reviews.reviewTitle: Little big for a big guy.
reviews.review: I’m 6’2” 270 lbs. and I’m wearing two long sleeve shirts in the photos. Ordered a 2XL. It’s a bit big on me, probably could have done the XL. But I’m going to keep it as a work hoodie. I am hoping it will shirk in the wash. The material is a little thin, but that’s what I wanted. Good quality.

reviews.name: Fernando Pacheco
reviews.review:
Esta es una sudadera que por el precio es bastante buena sin embargo hay que tener un poco de cuidado con la talla y algunos detalles que tiene.

La talla:
Esta sudadera se espera que sea algo holgada por lo que viene más grande de la talla común sin embargo las tallas no están hechas con el estándar Mexicano por lo que si deseas que te quede floja pide una talla menos que la que normalmente utilizas en ropa Mexicana, si deseas que te quede justa puedes pedir hasta 2 tallas abajo pero igual que muchas sudaderas con el uso se hacen algo grandes y puede variar un poco la talla.

A favor:
-Precio bajo
-Tela bastante ligera que permite la respiración, ideal para días frescos y cuando se desea algo no grueso.
-Tal como venía es la talla en la que se mantiene, crece un poco pero no se encoge para nada como sucede con algunas sudaderas.

Neutro:
-El color no es el más duradero que puedes encontrar, el sol y las lavadas la decoloran fácilmente y en algunos meses el color será notoriamente más claro, pero por el precio es algo aceptable.
-Las tallas son algo confusas y seguro no es a lo que uno está acostumbrado por lo que hay que tener cuidado.
-Al contener material reciclado al sacarla del empaque tiene un poco de olor químico el cual se va con una lavada o dejando la prenda fuera del empaque por 2 días.

En contra:
-Los cordones para ajustar el gorro son de calidad baja y se pueden deshacer o deshilar fácilmente, sobre todo con el cierre y si eres una persona que suele morderlos o jugar con ellos se deteriorarán rápidamente.

reviews.name: Geraldine
reviews.review:
I got the royal blue one for my husband in Large. He is tall and slim (usually wears 38 or size Medium) but likes hoodies a looser to allow for layers underneath. He is very happy with this purchase!😂

Good value, compared to similar products from other brands.

Nice, deep blue, zipper works fine, generous pockets, nice material not too thick or thin...just right.

Have not washed this hoodie yet, I will update review if any issues with excessive shrinkage or color loss.

Would buy more in different colours,based on this one.

Helpful votes are always appreciated!😊

reviews.name: Emma s
reviews.review:
I am 5’9 - 150 lbs - size 29 waist -size 6 Lululemon
I ordered because I didn’t want to pay the Aritzia price- obviously those are amazing quality for $90 but this $20 is good for a basic zip up. Not thick. Fleece inside. I wanted an oversized look but will be ordering more in M. No complaints!

title: London Fog Men's Auburn Zip-Front Golf Jacket (Regular & Big-Tall Sizes)
description: Auburn zip-front golf jacket ( regular & Big-Tall sizes )

reviews.name: John S
reviews.review:
Ended up trying a regular XL on a 7 day trial and then purchased the XL Tall. I’m 6’5, so like most regular XLs this jacket was too short in length and in the arms. Probably fits someone else great but not me. Luckily with the XL tall size, this jacket fit perfectly.

It seems to be great in the fall and as an over coat with a hoodie underneath in the winter. It’s a nice windbreaker material but keeps you warm. Will definitely getting my moneys worth with this one and will be buying this jacket in different colors.

reviews.name: Jeffrey A. Moon
reviews.review: Loved this so much I bought four more in various colors. Very well tailored!!! Nice soft fabric. Quality stitching and zippers. I can tell these will last. Plenty of non conspicuous pockets. Repels light rain. I’m 5’10” and weigh 165 pounds. Slim build with somewhat broad shoulders, long torso and arms. The medium gives me a perfect, leaning towards roomy fit in the chest area. Perfect length at waist and arms. Make sure it has the London Fog label as one of mine was a different jacket.  corrected that quickly and the other four I purchased were correct. If interested in the yellow, the pics are confusing showing it as bright yellow and another pic shows more of a light beige color. Mine was a very nice pale yellow. The pink is very pale as well. I don’t normally wear much pink but this very pale pink is nice. Doesn’t scream PINK. Also have the black, green and beige matching the display pictures. Excellent price for such quality.

reviews.name: A photographer
reviews.review:
In my area it's only really cold a few days of the year. While I own several coats and jackets that keep me warm during those few times, they are too warm the rest of the time. I needed something light, something to keep off a chill while holding off the wind and the occasional light mist. Enter two great choices: The London Fog Auburn Jacket and the Weatherproof Classic Golf Jacket. Both jackets were available from  at reduced prices so I bought both. The bottom line is I like both and I'm keeping both. Both are similar and both are winners. My advice is to buy based on color and cost because you can't really lose.

The Weatherproof Classic Golf Jacket differs from the Auburn Jacket by having knit cuffs and bottom edge. The Auburn Jacket has elastic in the bottom edge and the cuffs snap closed. I have no preference either way. The outer fabric of both is microfiber polyester (whatever happened to poly/cotton twill, I wonder). Both feel like the same weight and look like they could have been cut from the same bolts of cloth except for the colors. The liners are a little different with the Weatherproof being slightly heavier but in no way bulky or thick. The Auburn has a lighter feeling fabric inside. Again, I have no preference either way. Fit-wise they are very much alike. The Weatherproof is a little longer in the body than the Auburn when the Auburn is bought in standard sizes. Personally, I probably should have gotten the tall size of the Auburn but reviews indicated the Auburns sleeves are a bit too long and tall sizes usually have even longer sleeves. I'm almost exactly six feet tall with a long torso so I can usually go either standard or tall without either seeming off. I ordered the Auburn in standard length and it's okay but just a tad short. However, I wouldn't want the sleeves to be any longer. The Weatherproof fits me perfectly in length and the sleeves are okay too--not as long as those on the Auburn. I ordered XXL in both jackets and I cannot detect any difference in the fit around the chest or waist. They're roomy enough in my case for wearing a heavy sweater if need be. I've worn them with thick sweatshirts but nothing heavier.

I've worn both jackets in 45F weather but not in the rain. Both cut the wind well. I don't expect either to be waterproof like my Eddie Bauer rain parka. Probably fine for a light mist or a quick shower. What I find so great about these jackets is that they're comfortable over a wide range of temperatures. I can wear one while driving without having to deal with the bulk of a heavier coat and I can wear it indoors for extended periods without feeling overheated. Even on cold days, I usually only need a jacket for those times I'm outdoors between buildings or from the car to a building. I only need a really warm coat when I'm outside for more than a few minutes.

Which to buy? Both are great. I have a tan London Fog Auburn and a light blue Weatherproof Classic Golf. Both colors will coordinate and match with other colors fine. The London Fog has more color choices here on Amazon so that might be a factor. My decision was made based on price. At the time I bought both jackets, the prices were at a low point and both jackets were bargains.

EDIT 01/18/2019:

I've worn both these jackets for a while now and I have to give the edge to the London Fog. That's based on a couple of things about the Weatherproof that wasn't evident at first. Mainly it has to do with the knit cuffs on the Weatherproof. In a very short time, they are beginning to pill on the right side of my jacket. I'm not sure this speaks well for the quality of the fabric for the longterm. Another thing I did not notice early on is that the cuffs on the Weatherproof do not match. The left cuff's knit is different from the right. This might explain the pilling of the right cuff. However, I admit I like the way the knit cuffs fit compared to the snap cuffs of the London Fog. On the London Fog, the cuffs feel either too tight or too loose, depending on which snap I use.

reviews.name: Customer
reviews.review: The overall fit was wonderful! Sleeves long enough, chest good, BUT, just wish it was about 2 inches longer in length. For a TALL, it was a little to short. But we will keep it, because it always seems we can’t find things quite long enough. Great fabric.

reviews.name: Alessar
reviews.reviewTitle: Dapper lightweight jacket for the plus size man
reviews.review: I'm at a size where it's quite difficult to find men's big and tall that fits me well. Often the proportions are bad or the size is not a good fit because there's so much a regularity in what a 2x means for people and brands. I was very happy with this jacket I had been looking for a lightweight jacket I could layer with a hoodie or where during the transitional fall weeks. It very much met my expectations and I've received compliments on how nice it looks. London Fog has come through with a good quality classic item here.

reviews.name: Patricia Holmes
reviews.review: This jacket is wrinkly and the zipper is sticking when pulling it down hence the four stars. If u don’t like this don’t buy it.

reviews.name: Omar
reviews.review:
This was on sale when i purchased it. I didnt have a bomber jacket and this fit the bill!

It is a nice quality, and not too thick. So, it can be worn on cooler days as well.

reviews.name: brett miller
reviews.review: This jacket is an awesome jacket. way better than i thought especially for the price. its soft texture on outer and inner shell is the first thing i noticed. it looks cool not like something a kook would put on. it has a designer fashion with nice lines and cutout features. i like the collar it gives it a professional look unlike others that dont have a collar. im going to order up to 3x big because i go baggy for more comfort the 2 x is a tad tight for my taste. all in all i would recommend not wasting time and just buy it if you want a jacket that covers all your needs except maybe rain or ice cold weather its good for going out and looking sharp in.

reviews.name: kronos4ever
reviews.review: Generous sizing means the XL fits my 44 chest and 6’3” frame perfectly. A very smart looking jacket that feels good quality. 5/5

reviews.name: Freda
reviews.review: Very smart and good quality

reviews.name: Customer
reviews.review: I bought a medium sized jacket. On paper it’s the right size but this seems huge.

reviews.name: William Savage.
reviews.review: When l recieved this jacket it was in a plastic bag and the jacket had so many creases in it l could not believe the condition of the jacket,very disappointed with this.

title: Columbia Men's Steens Mountain 2.0 Full Zip Fleece Jacket, Black, Large
description:
Product Details

100% Polyester

Imported
Fur Description
Machine Wash

Bangladesh
About this Item
SOFT FABRIC: This Columbia Men's Steens Mountain Full Zip 2.0 Fleece Jacket is crafted of ultra-soft 100% polyester MTR filament fleece for the perfect amount of warmth
HANDY FEATURES: This fleece jacket features two side zippered security pockets to keep your small items secure
ULTIMATE COMFORT: With a collared neck and zippered closure, you're sure to be protected from the frigid cold
CLASSIC FIT: A modern classic fit and with a soft, lightweight feel make this fleece jacket a staple for comfortable outdoor activity
VERSATILE: Soft and warm, this fleece jacket is the perfect layer for any winter activity
PRODUCT UPDATE: Jacket may come with “Columbia” embroidered or logo patch sewn on.  Both are authentic Columbia Sportswear products.
Description

A soft fleece layer is a must for any fall, winter, or spring wardrobe—even more so for cross-campus walks, that’s why our collegiate version of the Columbia Flanker III Fleece Jacket was made. This is a soft, cold weather ready staple, and everyday style piece in support of your alma-mater. You're bound to be warm and worry-free in this fleece jacket crafted of our super-soft polyester filament fleece. It's the perfect layering piece and first line of defense to combat cold outings. When high activity is a factor, a classic fit allows for comfortable movement that you'll appreciate. Zippered side pockets keep hands and small items secure and warm. An added bonus is the warm collar that's flexible enough to wear up or down – depending on your desired level of toastiness. Columbia offers this collegiate jacket with multiple college logos and in a variety of sizes. To ensure the size you choose is right, utilize our sizing chart and the following measurement instructions: For the sleeves, start at the center back of your neck and measure across the shoulder and down to the sleeve. If you come up with a partial number, round up to the next even number. For the chest, measure at the fullest part of the chest, under the armpits and over the shoulder blades, keeping the tape measure firm and level.

See more
About this Item

reviews.name: Jordan W.
reviews.review:
Bought the heather gray zip-up from the same seller and it was a different material. This seems to be of a more "crushed", shorter fleece and not FULL fleece like the heather gray one I bought before. This isn't a big issue for me besides that the two items were advertised as the same. They definitely aren't. I can't tell whether this one is a knock-off or just a different Columbia garment altogether. Also I have seen arguments in the reviews whether or not this garment is actually black. Even being shiny, crushed-style fleece.. this doesn't look black at all, does it? It can't decide whether it wants to be charcoal gray or navy blue.
Overall, it is a great garment. It's warm, soft, looks great dressed up or down - but the way it's presented here on  is a little misleading.
I am 6' 0", 181 lbs, wearing a size Large.

reviews.name: Jorge Isaac
reviews.reviewTitle: Great Jacket but not Truly Black
reviews.review: The Jacket itself is great! Since it is fleece, it’s not truly “black” it’s more like a dark charcoal. Super soft and warm. I will definitely be buying one for my wife .

reviews.name: Customer
reviews.review: Quality and comfort as expected from Columbia. Also, a great price.

reviews.name: Leo
reviews.reviewTitle: The color does not match the description.
reviews.review: The color does not match the description.

reviews.name: BadAzteK
reviews.reviewTitle: Bought Two of These...Odd sizing...Very nice and warm!!!
reviews.review:
So I bought two of these fleece sweaters and both are made well and very warm. Style is comfortable and overall as expected. My only dilema is this. In black this fleece fits a bit snug, but pretty close to the average size large. The tag says large and what not. However I also bought the same fleece in Red and this one fits a bit larger almost like it were an extra large, but not quite as big. Still bigger and more roomy than the black. Again, both say large and all the tags seem correct. As for me, I'm pretty much small enough to wear a large, but also big enough to wear an extra large without it looking too huge. So, what am I to do? Do I keep both knowing one is a big more snug while the other is a bit more roomy? Who knows, but if you were to buy two of these that would be the only way to compare the different feels on these two fleece sweaters that are supposed to be identical in every way except the color. I'm keeping both because they are very comfortable, but again my dilema being the odd sizing between the two colors. I'm tempted to e mail columbia on the issue, but not sure what they will say. I may anyway and if so I will update this review later. Enjoy and keep warm...these fleece sweaters will serve you well.

UPDATE: So I returned the smaller size of the black fleece and ordered an extra large one. I got one labeled "L" and fits like the red one which fit more like an extra large fleece. Basically in a nut shell, I'M DONE WITH COLUMBIA. Sizes and quality control cannot be trusted. The sweaters are nice in terms of the fabric, but everyone is making fleeces now. You can get a normally sized fleece at W@lmart and it would probably be more true to the labeled size than gambling on Columbia sizes. Between returning the products, shipping labels, inconvenience, I probably broke even or so had I just bought this retail and picked the size that fit me in person. If you want to gamble on what size you're actually going to get compared to the labeled product and what you actually ordered then by all means keep buying Columbia and figure it out on your own. I'd rate these fleeces at about a 2 stars only because I like the fabric, but its not worth the hassle because Columbia doesn't have their sizes or tags in order. Were these all just one big oops and being pawned off on  to clean house, or does Columbia care? Well, glad you asked because I contacted them and their best solution was to order one directly from them instead etc. Really? So if I bought a HONDA from a dealership and the car is all screwed up, then does that mean I have to go to Japan to get it squared away? What's the point? Funny, I used to work for HONDA and they made sure the cars were in order. On the other hand Columbia either cares about the products they are putting their NAME ON, or they don't. From my experience....they don't. You think they are going to issue a recall for these fleeces? NOPE. It's easier to sell them anyway and have people lose money, time, and convenience sending them back and forth to AMAZON because the sizes were screwed up in a factory overseas. I'm surprised  is still selling these with all of the conflicting reviews on the sizing. Sorry COLUMBIA, I own 3 products from you....you're OUT!! No more.

reviews.name: Nicholas
reviews.reviewTitle: Good, but black color faded quickly.
reviews.review: This jacket is comfortable, fits fine (I'm a size large), and is super affordable. The only issue is that I bought the black one, and even though I've only washed it with the Woolite detergent meant for super delicate clothing, the black color immediately lightened, so it doesn't look that great now. If this jacket stayed a dark black, it would be perfect. Still, even with the color fading, I still wear mine.

reviews.name: Customer
reviews.review: Jacket was nice. It was an obvious return, it had wash clothes in the pockets. I gave it as a gift and was embarrassed

reviews.name: Jimmii
reviews.review:
The black does not look like a true black to me. There is a blueish tint to it.
The jacket is very warm but breathable, you can feel wind passing though the sleeves.

I like that the front zipper pockets close going up so you can zip them up partially so things won’t just slide out but you can still access them.
It has big wide interior pockets too at the stomach area. And the packets are deep. Adjustable waist is nice too.
Overall would recommend, worn it for about a month now.

reviews.name: Marion A
reviews.review: Bought this for my husband and he liked it and he is a picky shopper. The fit was as expected for a large. Well made and it has inside pockets. The only thing he mentioned is that it wasn't as thick as he had hoped. He felt it would be good into early summer but he would need something warmer for the cooler spring, fall and winter weather in southern Ontario.

reviews.name: Maximus 🛡️
reviews.review: Es un buen producto, buena calidad de materiales, es cómoda y es calientita, ideal para llevarla debajo de la chamarra en ocasiones de frío intenso, el único detalle por el cual no doy 5 estrellas, es que pedí negra y parece más bien un gris oscuro.

reviews.name: Cliente
reviews.review: Calidad precio inmejorable, ante todo pedir una talla o dos menos de este polar, es tallaje americano , la cremallera va al lado contrario, algo que tampoco supone mucho problema cuando te acostumbras. Queda bastante bien puesta, abriga bien, el color no es negro intenso, más bien tirando a gris oscuro, pero esta chula. Por 19 euros más que recomenble siendo de esta marca.

reviews.name: ANDRES MOYSEN
reviews.review: Solo tengo una duda yo recuerdo que el nombre de Columbia lo tenían bordado pero ahora lo veo como una etiqueta cosida?

reviews.name: Dennis t
reviews.review: Buena compra, un poco largo de ñas.mangas y cintura pero se siente bien y calienta bien

About this Item
WIND- AND WATER-RESISTANT - A special waterproof coating will come in handy whenever the weather takes a turn.
LIGHT AND PACKABLE - Great to take along for weekend getaways, sports, or picnics.
PROTECTION ALL AROUND - Bungee-cord scuba-style hood, elasticized cuffs, and open bottom hem with bungee-cord protect against the elements.

FABRIC TO FEEL GOOD ABOUT - 100% recycled polyester is fabric you can feel good about wearing.
THE MARK OF A CHAMPION - The iconic Champion logo is screened on the front chest; the "C" logo is appliquéd on the left cuff.
Description

This lightweight, zip-front hooded jacket from Champion will become a go-to style in your casual wardrobe, from your golf bag to your gym bag to your weekend getaway tote bag. Wind-and water-resistant, this ultra-light style has a full-zip front and features a handy scuba-style neckline and hood with bungee cord closure. This packable jacket is roomy enough for easy layering over a sweatshirt or sweater. Thoughtful details include rain flaps in front and back, elasticized cuffs to keep out wind and rain, plus a bungee-cord hem to adjust as you choose. This packable jacket has angled front pockets for keeping essentials handy and proudly displays the Champion script logo on the left chest and the iconic "C" logo appliquéd at the left cuff. And one of the best things about this hooded full-zip jacket it is that it's made of 100% recycled polyester you can feel good about wearing.

title: DLGJPA Men's Mountain Waterproof Ski Jacket Hooded Windbreakers Windproof Raincoat Winter Warm Snow Coat
description:
Zipper closure
Multipurpose：An essential and relaxed-fit outdoor & travelling insulated jacket,ideal outfits for Downhill Skiing,Snowboarding,Snow Sports, Hiking,Mountaineering,Camping,Rock Climbing,Cycling and other winter outdoor activities.

Size notes: Jacket offers a standard fit. Please choose by US size. It would be good fit for you. If any problem with material or size please contact us. We’ll happy to solve your request.

reviews.name: ShoeZ
reviews.review: Bought the jacket for our Winter Vacation in Europe this year (2022). At first I wasn't sure if my husband would be okay with it, but lets just say, for a guy who doesn't like to mess up his hair, the hood came in handy for those long walks about towns with the snow and drizzle coming down. It kept his ears covered, his head stayed warm, it had nice zipper pockets (one interior), wonderful inner lining, and folded down easy to fit back into our vacuum seal bag for our suitcase. The jacket has velcro and an interior zipper, the sleeves did have velcro to tighten around the wrist, and it covered his back pants pockets (he's 5'10"). Perfect jacket for our upcoming ski trip also.

reviews.name: Gorilla on a scooter
reviews.review:
I was impressed it actually fit me and wasn't snug im 6'8" and 310 lbs 37 inch sleeves been wearing in the rain hasn't leaked.
I ride a motorcycle as my year around daily transportation and its held up in the snow and rain.
I've had for 4 months zippers seem to be strong and there's a coating of something over the zippers so no water gets in.
Its very warm for large men finding jackets that fit are sometimes difficult but this one has meet all my expectations.

reviews.name: Golf2ls
reviews.review: This is a really nice jacket for the price point. Let's face it, I am hard on winter jackets. I have an Eddie Bauer and two Colombia winter jackets that have recently failed. To be fair, the Eddie Bauer is over twenty years old and one of the Colombia jackets was ripped by a dogs claw. The zipper is a common point of failure on two of them. The zipper on this jacket seems secure. I am less enthused about the Velcro closures around the zipper, not a real fan of Velcro. This jacket is waterproof, helping to cut the wind. I appreciate the inner pocket for a wallet and a similar outer pocket for sundry items. Two large regular side pocket hold gloves, hat, keys, and any other items. I am happy with this purchase.

reviews.name: Matthew Glover
reviews.review: Purchased this for my dad. He says it's nice and warm. The hood zips off which he likes. The cell phone pocket in the chest area is slightly small. Has nice inside pockets. It comes vacuum sealed so it will stay wrinkled for a while but he likes the jacket.

reviews.name: Colleen M. Drajem
reviews.review: Got this for my son for Christmas and he loves it. He is a volunteer firefighter and wears it all the time. I got the next size up so he can put layers underneath if needed.

reviews.name: Brandon Walthall
reviews.review: Nice coat overall, it's keeps you warm in the Chicago winter do far so good. Just wish the fake zippers on the front outside was a real pocket, but it's really a good coat , andgood quality .,

reviews.name: Anthony Gee
reviews.review: Fits well and pretty true to size. I'm 6ft 175lbs and the medium is a great fit. I did not notice the hood having the 3 inch velcro tabs for chin neck area. When I got it I didn't not appreciate that part, that is until now that the wind has picked up and the weather is a lot colder. Definitely appreciate the feature now.

reviews.name: Leigh G.
reviews.review: Teenage son says it's a surprisingly warm and comfortable coat. It's not bulky at all. It's his new favorite coat.

reviews.name: Lizzet Caballero Vazquez

reviews.review: La tela muy bien, la verdsd es que is calienta y esta muy bonita, resultó mejor de lo que esperaba
