reviews.name: Mitch
reviews.review: Super warm. Warer resistant for sure. Looks just as shown in the pictures and sizing is pretty spot on. Most reviews around my hieght purchased mediums for the same weight bracket 150 lbs. I bought a large. Im 5'9" @ 150 lbs. I like a slightly loose fit to my coats and this didn't disappoint. Length puts it just below my belt line. Shoulders have a little extra room, but not too much. Sleeves don't have fleece lining, but they are lined well and keep your arms warm wearing nothing more than a t-shirt under it. Sleeve length is great as well. Not short, not long. Hood is fleece lined. Left handed zipper. Its an amazing buy for anyone looking for a nice, warm, and comfortable winter coat. Don't hesitate to buy if you need an inexpensive coat without losing visual appearance. Sizing is pretty on point.

reviews.name: Patrick H.
reviews.review: Purchased the XL in the cobalt blue/black combination and it's perfect. Fits like a glove. Noticed immediately how important the fleece lining is to keeping warm. Hood is nice and a with a little room for a ski hat or any hat. The Velcro strap keeps the hood in place under my chin. I love it! 👍🏻👍🏻

reviews.name: jon stolpe
reviews.review: This coat is SO RAD, It looks good but even better than that it works awesome, I stay so warm in this thing. If you need a good winter coat don't even think twice, get this thing you'll be very very happy with what you get.

reviews.name: muhammad nuredeen
reviews.review:
Just in time for Chicago winter and heavy winds. Was able to be outside in -7 degree weather for 20 min and felt good. As a 6ft male 205lbs I got a large and still have room for a smaller fall coat underneath for better warmth.
Love it.

reviews.name: Nancy Snow
reviews.review: Very nice jacket, stylish, plenty of pockets, and will definately keep you warm in the cold months ahead. Husband loves it.

reviews.name: Kevin B.
reviews.review: I ordered this for a trip to Steamboat where the avg temp was 20F and it was perfect. I’m 6’3 225 and the XXL was a great fit over long underwear and a turtleneck. Add some gloves and face covering and this jacket will keep you cozy!!

reviews.name: Elizabeth
reviews.reviewTitle: Works perfectly in cold, rain and snow!
reviews.review: I got this for my grandson, he loves it. We're in Washington, where it's currently snowing and tells me that he's sweating a little.

reviews.name: Brittany
reviews.review: This coat fits perfect!!! It’s so warm and not bulky. Definitely gonna by myself another one.

reviews.name: Legally Red ♡
reviews.review:
This coat was bought for my 14 years old son and he loves it. There are 2 main pockets and a third smaller pocket in the front. And there is an inside pocket as well on the left side.

The body of the jacket and the removable hood is lined with warm fur-like fabric.

There is no adjustable elastic at the bottom of the jacket to prevent snow from going up the jacket. However, that being said, my son has been wearing this coat for 4 months now and he plays with his 3 younger brothers in the snow all the time and he has never had any issues with snow getting into his coat. He's worn it in -25C weather and wasn't cold at all.

When asked what he loves about this coat, his answer is always the same. He says it is super comfortable to wear and it keeps him warm and toasty and the hood is not only big enough to protect his head but protects most of his face as well. Overall a great purchase. Would recommend.

If my review was helpful let me know by clicking on the ''Helpful'' button :) 👍🏻

reviews.name: Andrew Riddles
reviews.review:
Just to let you know, I ordered this in November to see if I could get away with a winter coat at the cheaper end of the market. I am only writing a review now because we have now had some cooler days here in Ottawa. Last week we had -18C [for those in the mediaeval states that still use Fahrenheit, that is -1F (or 33 degrees below freezing point)]. The "Feels like" temperature was -25C (which is -13F, or 45 degrees below freezing point). For those who don't experience these kind of temperatures, your eye lashes start to freeze together at that temperature, and your nose hairs freeze. In the wind, especially if your fingers or other extremities are wet and exposed, you risk frostbite. THIS COAT though kept me warm - with just a t-shirt and a cable knit cotton sweater underneath. It's the real deal - it works in very cold temperatures.

(Waits patiently for someone from Winnipeg to come on and say I don't know what the word cold means because I live in Ottawa where the winters are 'warm' compared to Winnipeg...)

UPDATE: Winter is almost done (It only lasted 18 months this year). I stand by my initial review, except to say if you live somewhere tropical like Britain, it will be way too warm for your winters. Great for -20C - -30C (For those countries still in the 18th century that is between -4F and -22F).

reviews.name: Crosbyman
reviews.reviewTitle: nice but... sleeves long and armpits narrow
reviews.review:
Received today Dec.13 fast delivery
fit wise… 2 basic issues with my xxl size ( I am 5 foot10 …...260 lbs heavy set guy )
sleeves found to be a bit to long for me….. but better to long than to short :-)
coat is a bit tight under the armpits
overall quality looks fine but I have not experienced it in really cold temps yet….

I am keeping it but if store bought locally….I would have tried a few more on the rack for better fit.

update jan 25 2020... Very satisfied coat performed great at -20C

update march 30… winter is over coat was great no complaints great product

reviews.name: Mark Samuel
reviews.review: Recieved this coat yesterday. It fits perfectly! I know by reading the reviews and also when I read them the most frightening part is ordering the right size. I'm 5'7 and 210 pounds, I ordered a XL and it's perfect. I ordered one for my son he is 5'8 and 160 got him a large, again a perfect fit! As for the cost itself. It is very warm, not bulky at all. Yesterday it was -20 celcius and I wanted to test it so I just put a Golf polo on with the coat and I was warm! So all in all a great coat for the price.

reviews.name: Geoff
reviews.review:
The jacket arrived on time and is a perfect fit. I ordered the XXL and am 6'3" and approximately 280lbs (127Kg) and it just fits with a bit of room to spare. The arm length is good and zipping up the jacket with a smaller jacket underneath is done with no issue but not a lot of room to maneuver. Not tight but not overly loose either. I can also comment on the one user who said the zipper is flimsy. If you go hard at that zipper, it likely will break off. It is not rugged. If you calmly zip the jacket up, you will have no problem.

I have walked with this jacket/smaller jacket combo in -7 Celsius with good warmth, even a little hot after 15 minutes. In 0 degree Celsius this is too hot. I live in the North where the temperature will get down to -50, with an average around -35 in the January - April months. I will do up an addition to this review when I have gone through a few days like that. Until then, this is a very good jacket for the money and so far, serving me well.

About this Item
SOFT FABRIC: This Columbia Men's Steens Mountain Full Zip 2.0 Fleece Jacket is crafted of ultra-soft 100% polyester MTR filament fleece for the perfect amount of warmth
HANDY FEATURES: This fleece jacket features two side zippered security pockets to keep your small items secure
ULTIMATE COMFORT: With a collared neck and zippered closure, you're sure to be protected from the frigid cold
CLASSIC FIT: A modern classic fit and with a soft, lightweight feel make this fleece jacket a staple for comfortable outdoor activity
VERSATILE: Soft and warm, this fleece jacket is the perfect layer for any winter activity
PRODUCT UPDATE: Jacket may come with “Columbia” embroidered or logo patch sewn on.  Both are authentic Columbia Sportswear products.
Description

A soft fleece layer is a must for any fall, winter, or spring wardrobe—even more so for cross-campus walks, that’s why our collegiate version of the Columbia Flanker III Fleece Jacket was made. This is a soft, cold weather ready staple, and everyday style piece in support of your alma-mater. You're bound to be warm and worry-free in this fleece jacket crafted of our super-soft polyester filament fleece. It's the perfect layering piece and first line of defense to combat cold outings. When high activity is a factor, a classic fit allows for comfortable movement that you'll appreciate. Zippered side pockets keep hands and small items secure and warm. An added bonus is the warm collar that's flexible enough to wear up or down – depending on your desired level of toastiness. Columbia offers this collegiate jacket with multiple college logos and in a variety of sizes. To ensure the size you choose is right, utilize our sizing chart and the following measurement instructions: For the sleeves, start at the center back of your neck and measure across the shoulder and down to the sleeve. If you come up with a partial number, round up to the next even number. For the chest, measure at the fullest part of the chest, under the armpits and over the shoulder blades, keeping the tape measure firm and level.

title: Carhartt Men's Bartlett Jacket (Regular and Big & Tall Sizes)
description: Sherpa-lined and cordura-reinforced, this durable duck jacket will keep you working hard, with an attached hood for added warmth and comfort.

reviews.name: S.K. Inman
reviews.review: Before purchasing this jacket I read as many reviews as possible on the sizing. When ordering clothes online we all want to avoid the pain of having to return them for a different size. One thing that stuck out to me was that people said the jacket runs big. I usually wear a medium in most shirts but with coats and jackets I usually get a large. I decided to go with the medium expecting it to fit more like a large based upon the reviews. I also have a Carhartt hoodie that is a medium and it’s pretty loose on me so the reviews that said it runs big seemed reasonable to me. I’m a 6 foot male with a 40 inch chest and I weigh 165lbs. I first put the jacket on over a t-shirt and it seemed a perfect fit but I would definitely not want it any smaller. The thing is I plan on this being my winter work coat and where I live it frequently gets 20 degrees Fahrenheit and below and I will need to add a layer or two underneath for the extra warmth. I tried the jacket on over a hoodie and it was just too tight and without enough range of movement for what I do so I returned it for a large. The large seems to be perfect on me with a hoodie underneath and it’s still not too big with just a shirt so I should be able to get more usage out of this jacket other than just the coldest winter months. The jacket itself is great quality. Triple stitching, tough materials, and draw strings on the hood and lower hem to customize the fit. I highly recommend this jacket and just about everything Carhartt makes. Hope my experience on the sizing is helpful. If you’re kinda in between sizes like I am maybe order the two sizes you fall between and keep the one that fits the way you want.

reviews.name: Dave T.
reviews.review:
I needed to replace my everyday coat when the zipper busted. I was tempted to buy a different coat at half the price which would have been adequate, but I've wanted a Carhartt for a while and decided to spend the extra for the Carhartt. I'm glad I did.

First the delivery was optimal. I ordered it on a Thursday morning and it was delivered Friday afternoon by the time I got home from work.

I cannot speak to the durability as I've only written it one time. But it feels substantial. It is definitely heavier than your average winter coat, so that probably speaks to the durability.

It was probably not cold enough in the morning when I put it on and I could have opted for a lighter jacket and been alright, but I was like a kid with a new toy, and it is very warm. By the afternoon it had warned up with sharp winds and it wasn't too warm.

With thick cuffs, and a bottom cinch chord this cost is windproof.

The pockets are great. There are two chest pockets, with snap closures, and one of these is a double pocket with a Velcro pocket. There are also two side pockets.

There are two internal pockets, one with a zippered closure that is large enough to accommodated my Moto Power G in a case so even in a downpour the phone will stay dry. The other internal pocket has a Velcro closure. So there will be plenty of room to keep your stuff.

I've had knock off Carhartt coats before that lasted a year or two but I think the phrase often imitated never duplicated rings especially true for this cost

reviews.name: Connie Berg
reviews.reviewTitle: Perfect fit to tall thin men.
reviews.review: I bought this for my son-in-law for Christmas, and he loves it! He's 6'4" tall, is very thin with long arms, and this jacket in medium tall fits him great. The sherpa lining and hood is nice and warm in the below freezing temperatures that we're experiencing.

reviews.name: Colleen
reviews.reviewTitle: Legendary brand that keeps living up to its reputation
reviews.review:
The jacket was available in Big & Tall and the sizing was completely accurate. This was absolutely necessary because I bought this for my 6'4" son.
It's warm and the outer shell is great at repelling rain and snow. Not 100% waterproof (and not advertised as such), but does a better than expected job at keeping out moisture.

reviews.name: Customer
reviews.review: This coat fits nice, looks great, is warm, and has more than enough pockets and is great quality! Fells nice and sturdy and and is overall an amazing coat!

reviews.name: mike c.
reviews.review: Good warm jacket, made from what appears to be rugged materials. Time will tell to see how this wears, but it looks very nicely made.

reviews.name: Rick H.
reviews.review: This seemed like a really nice jacket. I should have ordered the tall. Recipient was over 6 feet tall.

reviews.name: Customer
reviews.review: We purchased this jacket for my son for Christmas ever since he opened his present he has been wearing it and loves it

reviews.name: Michael Potts
reviews.reviewTitle: DO NOT BUY THIS IF YOU LIVE IN THE UK
reviews.review:
First of all, the jacket is fine but very short. So keep that in mind if you have a long body.

Secondly, this item was delivered from Germany (which isn't overly apparent when ordering), and if you need to return the item (as I have), it will cost you almost £40 in postage. For the extra cost, I'd advise you to steer clear and buy locally. Apparently, although the item was shipped with prime,  will not cover returns so be warned.

reviews.name: Customer
reviews.reviewTitle: Here is the scoop with the sizing, Read this if you are unsure about the fit
reviews.review:
Alright, So it seems to me that there is a bit of uncertainty with the sizing of this jacket and I think I can clear that up.

There seem to be 2 types of buyers for this coat, those who buy it for working conditions with layering and maneuverability in mind, and those that buy it simply for the aesthetics that want a more snug, modern slim fit.

As someone, who is using this jacket for work with layering in mind I purchased an xl tall (labeled big and tall on the size selection). I am 6"3 slim with shoulders on the broadside, this allows me to layer up,
On a typical day, I wear overalls, a cotton sweatshirt, and a thicker/heavier hoody underneath this jacket and still have some room to move comfortably. So if you are buying this for work, go with your typical workwear size, which for me typically is 36, 32-34 length pants and an XL top.

Now if you want to wear this jacket to be stylish, going on about town or a hike or whatever, and you don't think you'll be wearing heavy layers, its probably safe to say you can size down If I were to wear this jacket to a pub or something during winter/fall I would probably get the large, tall, or maybe even a medium-tall If I didn't lack the self-discipline to get rid of my beer belly.

If you have a longer torso I recommend getting tall, which again is labeled Big Tall on the  drop link so that it covers your waist as it does appear to be styled as a waist line jacket. (There is no big AND tall for this model I confirmed with carhartt, its just an increase in length)

I hope this is helpful and will clear up some of the sizing issues some of you are facing reading over the reviews and you can save yourself from the hassle of returns and exchanges

reviews.name: kody phillips
reviews.review:
I'm 5'11 225lbs muscular build. I ordered the XL tall. I live in Ottawa Canada so I needed a warm roomy coat like this.
These reviews on here are all over the place and very inaccurate, some people say it's too big, it's too small
. It's tough to go by all these *cough* wonderful *cough* reviews.
For reference I wear large size t shirts from Walmart.
I got an XL tall because L tall was sold out. The length of the coat is perfect but the sleeves are a bit long on me, I feel like the standard would have been too short on the coat as many have said, but the sleeves would have been better so pros and cons there. I'm not super tall but I wanted a longer coat.
I would have preferred the large no doubt in my mind but I'm not swimming in the XL. It fits just how an XL jacket should fit. Next time I will get large, no biggie. Jackets are always going to be a bit bigger than t shirt sizes to allow for layering you silly people. Duh.
The material is nice and tough the lining is very nice. The zipper is good quality. The front pockets are for HANDS not GEAR(stuff will fall out sideways)
The strings to adjust the hood have an interesting design. The little beads you squeeze to choke up on the strings and keep them from moving are actually hidden inside the trim of the coat which is a classy little feature, they aren't swinging like every other coat out there. The gussets on the back of the shoulders allow full movement, you are not constricted in any way. The elastic in the cuffs is pretty tight but should loosen over time.

Overall it's a fantastic jacket and I really have no real complaints. It's beautiful and built exceptionally well.
I will have to see how long it will last. I'm a mason and work outside often in the winter so that will be a good test to the longevity of this coat and I will report back here when it receives damage for you guys.

I have had bad experiences with Carhartt pants. The pants are so expensive and they did not last in my trade at all. Better off going dickies at half the price FOR PANTS that's just my opinion on that.

I will be buying the Bartlett again 100%.
At the $174 I paid here on  I think I the quality surpasses the price.

reviews.name: Customer
reviews.reviewTitle: and sellers need to explain return costs and countries better.
reviews.review:
Well made authentic item as you would expect from Carhartt.
This item does come up as larger fit and would recommend dropping down a size.
Sadly I found this out the hard way.
What  or the seller don’t explain is that, if you want to send this item back it will cost £45 from the UK to Germany. Which cost me a third of what the jacket actually cost.
There is nothing saying that it would have to go back to Germany which is a shame.
Also took me quite awhile and communication back forth to get my refund.
Not the easiest of transactions I’ve had and out of pocket too.

reviews.name: Miner
reviews.reviewTitle: Great coat, fits well. Read the full review.
reviews.review: Sat on the fence in buying this for a while due to the conflicting reviews about sizing. IF you go by the sizing chart for this item, I'd suggest going down a size, as it doesn't match up. I'm in the UK, 5'10", 15 stone, and an XL in everything (too many sweets, too little exercise), but according to the sizing chart I should've got an XXL. I took a punt, and ordered the XL. It fits great. Arm length size is fine, cost length is fine, and I could easily wear a hoodie underneath it and still do it up. It might be a little snug, and probably very warm, but I could. The Sherpa lining is only on the body and hood, the sleeves are lined with the normal shiny lining you get on some coats, but there is some kind of insulating between the lining and outer layer. It weighs quality, it's not a light jacket, which I like in a winter coat. There are elastic draw strings to tighten up the bottom of the jacket, and the hood just has a shoelace type draw cord. I've added some spring toggles to the hood cord, as if you did pull it tighter, it would otherwise not stay tight, unless you tied a pretty bow under your neck with both ends. No idea if I'll ever tighten it, but they're there if I want to. Overall very pleased with this jacket. Can't wait for winter to come so I can actually wear it. I had a similar coat years ago, which is by far the best coat I've ever had, but years of hard wearing have finally killed it (continuously looking for a replacement, hence why I bought this now). This coat is equally as good as that one from what I can tell. Bought it in Carhartt brown.

reviews.reviewTitle: More fall or spring for norther Ontario weather

reviews.reviewTitle: You need to have a long neck

reviews.name: Lana Rhodes
reviews.reviewTitle: Great fit (men's small), looks nice and warm and cozy.
reviews.review: The fit was true to size and the fuzzy inner lining looked like it would be super warm. Waterproof too which will add wind protection. I like that the hood is removable. Lots of pockets. This is for a growing teen boy, knowing that this year is probably going to be the only year of wear he will get from it; so it was also great not having to pay a fortune for a winter jacket. Winter jackets are UBER important in the Canadian Prairies between November and February, so getting a jacket that's not warm enough is a mistake no one wants to make. We shall see how it feels for him when the weather shows its ugly side throughout the remainder of winter, but it looks very promising.

About this Item

reviews.name: Anon
reviews.review: I ordered one of the cheaper jackets on , and that didn’t turn out well, and returned, then found this and though I’m not a fan of Columbia(don’t get me started), at least I know the brand well, and found the orange-red chili color for twenty five but Amazon showed it would take a month to deliver(watch out when ordering), so I looked again and then saw the blue one for twenty nine and ordered. Came with a retail price tag of seventy five. Whatever all that means. Was looking for a cheap rain jacket that works, that was all. I’m a short guy at 5’4” and 165lbs, 41-42” chest, and usually wear a 31-32 waist. I ordered a medium and it feels exactly half a size larger, likely tailored just a tad larger to give room for layers underneath. Being short, I expected the sleeves to be long on me, but they weren’t egregiously so, and the Velcro holds at wrists so sleeve length doesn’t seem like a big problem. This isn’t exactly like a fitted jacket but half and half between a windbreaker style and old fashioned raincoat. It’s a bit baggy and roomy. The cut is rather “universal” and I wish was a bit more slim and flattering but this way will fit most body types. Not a big deal tho. It does have a packable pocket inside for packing the jacket into but I haven’t tried it since I want to keep the DWR intact as long as possible before my hiking trip and don’t want to wrinkle up severely beforehand. The packable pocket is vented netting which I imagine would be friendly for wet jackets though I still wouldn’t pack a wet jacket for more than a day cause mold. I haven’t tried the waterproofing either but I bought this for hiking and later monsoon seasons in Southeast Asia, and so I got a backup poncho anyways, and the jacket label says waterproof(look picture), so yeah, it ain’t one of those windbreakers that some salesman is trying to sell as a rain jacket. I’m sure it will be fine for my use. The craftsmanship and manufacturing seems very well done, and all in all, can say for sure for thirty bucks was a bargain. Happy with it, though I kinda did like that red chili color better. This is one of those rain jackets that scream, “hey don’t judge my baggy fit cause I’m a raincoat,” and the orange color fits that a bit better imo. Too bad orange wasn’t in stock when I ordered, but the blue looks good too. The jacket does look and feel quality for a lowly rain jacket. Thumbs up.

reviews.name: James karr
reviews.reviewTitle: Best windbreaker raincoat ive ever owned
reviews.review: I love this jacket super light and easy to pack in the bag it fits your size really nicely it has plenty of room so you can put on your big thick warm jacket on underneath and put this over the top to keep the wind and rain out. Ide buy this again in a heartbeat

reviews.name: N. Morgan
reviews.reviewTitle: Another great Columbia product for bigger people
reviews.review:
This is a nice lightweight jacket that comes in a variety of sizes. It works well in wind and keeps me dry in rain. It's pretty thin, so it's more of a spring/fall jacket on its own, but with a fleece or heavy zip up hoodie underneath it works well in the winter as well.

I just want to thank Columbia for understanding that bigger people need clothing too. Most brands cap out at 2XL - 3XL, but Columbia makes high quality yet affordable apparel for people of all shapes and sizes.

reviews.name: J
reviews.review: I bought this for my boyfriend for Christmas and he absolutely loves it. He is a bigger man so we was worried zit wouldn't fit right after buying it. I'm very happy with the fit and so thankful I don't have to return this one. I wish all brands made their sizes the same.

The only drawback is sweating which makes it not suitable for activities.

Including tailgating prior to the game, I was in a steady rainfall, not hard, but steady, for about 5 straight hours. In all that time, all my layers underneath stayed dry, allowing me to stay warm for the entire day. I am extremely pleased with this product and would highly recommend as a rain jacket.

reviews.reviewTitle: falsley advertised....this is NOT omni-tech breathable
reviews.review: I bought this jacket b/c the descriptions says: "This men's waterproof rain jacket features our signature Omni-Tech fabric" which is waterproof AND breathable. I was surprised when it arrived to find it feels juts like a nylon shell. On further research, the Columbia sites do not say that the Glennaker Lake rain jacket is omni-tech or breathable, so they must have pulled that description from another jacket. I am sure it is fine for what it is, but it has been falsely advertised. The Columbia site says :this jacket resists drizzle and downpour with a nylon shell and outdoor-ready style. And it is only $46.90 CDN on their site!

reviews.name: DaisyBank
reviews.review: Rainproof

reviews.name: Graham Cleary
reviews.review: Great Jacket and even better fit.

reviews.name: Mychiquibabylina
reviews.reviewTitle: Resistente al agua pero la manga muy amplia y sin forro
reviews.review:
La chamarra es muy ligera lo que la hace muy práctica y fácil de guardar o cargar.
Repele muy bien el agua que es para lo que está hecha.
La capucha se guarda dentro del cuello lo que lo hace un poco más resistente al frío en esa parte.
No es una chamarra para el frio pero es muy buena dejando el agua afuera.

Lo que no me gustó es que tiene las mangas muy anchas o amplias en proporción al cuerpo entonces se ve rara.

Tampoco tiene un forro interno en las mangas lo que la hizo muy incómoda ya qué con lluvia en el exterior y la humedad qué el cuerpo genera la tela se termina pegando a la piel dando la sensación de que traes un plástico.

Los puños son ajustable pero sin ajustar sin demasiado flojos y si los ajustas se concentra la humedad por dentro sobre los brazos haciendo que no sea cómoda.

Creo que es una muy buena opción siempre y cuando tú tengas puesta una prenda de manga larga forzosamente bajo la chamarra y así no tendrás los problemas que causa la falta de forro.

100% resistente al agua
50% cómoda pudo ser mejor en las mangas.

Las mangas son su punto débil.

reviews.reviewTitle: Excellent Value for Golf Rain Jacket
reviews.review: Have been looking for a lightweight rain jacket for golf at a reasonable price. Tried a couple of more expensive ones and wasn't real happy with them, it seems you either get lightweight or only water resistant, not waterproof. This one advertises water resistant but I was impressed with the material and expect it will hold up to a decent downpour. I have not had a chance to test it yet but the fabric is better than what I was expecting. I am normally a medium size for most things but ordered a large for this given I will use it for golf and the fit is great. It is lightweight and does not restrict movement. Not a fan of the brand logo on the chest but if all goes well I will only wear it a few times a year.

reviews.name: Mae
reviews.review: Product was great love the jacket 10/10 i would say just size down because i sized up

reviews.name: Legally Red ♡
reviews.review:
I bought this jacket for my 14 years old son. He has worn it throughout fall 2020 and is already wearing it again this spring (April 2021). It is lightweight and very well-made. It has 2 regular side pockets in the waist area as well as a large zippered front pocket in which the jacket can be folded into. When wearing the jacket, this extra large pocket is very practical for storing your keys, cellphone, earbuds, and any other personal items. Even though the fabric is thin, it keeps you warm during cooler windy days. The quality is good as we have had no issues at all with the fabric ripping.

It fits my son nicely and has a little extra space which is great since he can easily wear layers underneath. It is adjustable at the waist and it is wind and rain repellent. The hood is also a nice touch and helps keep him dry when he is out and about. It's stylish, comfortable and the fact that it can be neatly folded into a compact little pouch is definitely a plus. Great purchase. Would recommend.

If my review was helpful let me know by clicking on the ''Helpful'' button :) 👍🏻

reviews.name: Paul05

No tengo panza y tengo cuerpo plano sin mucho músculo (cuerpo de corredor jaja) Me quede bien ancho y largo ni muy ajustada ni muy holgada perfecta en ese aspecto, aunque como comentan varios compradores quizás un poco corta del largo de las mangas, apenas y me llegan a la muñeca aunque normalmente uso ese tipo de prendas con las mangas remangadas un poco por lo que no me afecta mucho ese detalle, pero si consideran que las mangas son cortas en lo largo. Si tienen mucho músculo en el pecho y brazos y normalmente son Talla M mejor pidan la L, ya que si viene justa en esas área les puede llegar apretar un poco esas zonas.
No le puse las 5 estrellas porque la chamarra no tiene buena ventilación y el material no transpira, es como uno de esas sudaderas de plástico que usan los boxeadores para sudar, por lo que para actividades físicas como correr van a sudar mucho con ella, aunque eso sí, con mucho estilo.

title: Columbia Men's Buck Butte Insulated Hooded Jacket
description:
Product Details
Fabric Type
100% Polyester; 100% Nylon
Care Instructions
Machine Wash
Origin
Imported
About this Item
COMFORTABLE MENSWEAR WINTER JACKET: This winter jacket features a water repellent shell made from Shadow Ripstop nylon, while the interior taffeta contains faux down for ultimate warmth and comfort
100% SYNTHETIC DOWN INSULATION: The down-style baffling is flexible at all the right points, providing additional air-loft, versatile fit, and maximum warmth and enjoyment
ADJUSTABLE HOOD SYSTEM: The adjustable hood integrates a soft chingaurd and is designed to keep your head warm in cold outdoor environments
HANDY POCKETS: This element ready jacket features two zippered hand pockets plus an interior security pocket
ACTIVE FIT: This jacket's down-style large baffling lends a functional and timeless look. Elastic cuffs and an adjustable drawcord hem reduce unwanted drafts
Description

When you live in a cold damp climate, finding a warm, comfortable, and water-resistant jacket is part of life. If you've been searching for a professionally designed and engineered men’s jacket, Columbia offers this superior solution. The Columbia Buck Butte Insulated Hooded Jacket is made for men with a modern active fit. It features our Shadow Ripstop nylon shell and incorporates premium synthetic down insulation. This coat provides comfy dry reprieve in most any environment. The adjustable hood is paramount in extreme winters, while the chin guard provides a nice touch of comfort. This water-repellent fabric and synthetic down is thoughtfully integrated into the coat and has been engineered with a series of features and baffles to improve overall usability and comfort. Includes an interior security pocket, two zippered hand pockets, elastic cuffs, and a drawcord adjusable hem. Available in a wide range of colors and sizes for men. Active Fit. To ensure the perfect fit, follow these steps for measuring and refer to the size chart. To determine the neck size, measure at the base or thickest part of your neck. For the sleeves, start at the center back of your neck and measure across the shoulder and down to the wrist. Round up to the next even number. For the chest, measure at the fullest part of the chest, under the armpits and over the shoulder blades, keeping the tape measure firm and level.

See more
About this Item

reviews.name: Customer
reviews.review: This is my first winter jacket and I love it! It’s able to keep me warm on the most bitter days and was immensely helpful when it was -25 outside. The only drawback is that it runs bigger on the sizing. This could be a good thing if you’re layering up, but I can also look sloppy if you don’t layer up. I will definitely buy from Columbia in the future.

reviews.review: The jacket looks good, feels good, light weight and warm. My husband likes it very much.

reviews.name: Nonnie N.

reviews.reviewTitle: A little long and no draw string to tighten around the waist waist
reviews.review: Most nice jackets have a draw string on the bottom to help fitting. This is a little too long and no draw string. Nice coat though, I kept it.

reviews.review: Nice Jacket

reviews.name: Dawn W.

reviews.name: yiftach tiran
reviews.review: loved it perfect for israel

reviews.name: A. Steven Toby
reviews.reviewTitle: It's lots warmer than you expect!
reviews.review:
My ratty old ski jacket from 1990 was obviously in need of replacement so I bought this. When I opened it up and tried it on I was disappointed -- it was so light and thin I didn't really believe it would be effective, but since it fit, I didn't send it back and then a cold day came and I decided to try it outdoors. Well, it is quite warm. As warm as the old ski jacket used to be and it had real down (this jacket is "insulated" but it uses synthetic, imitation down.) I'm not sure I have as free motion as I did with the old jacket but then again I'm too old for the slopes now, I just want to be comfortable outdoors. And the hood, which I didn't think was important when ordering, turns out to be very effective too at keeping my head warm, although the hood tends to fall down over my face and reduce my field of vision. These are minor drawbacks. The biggest negative is the slick, plasticky surface that feels unpleasant where it touches my skin (wear a hat under the hood and a scarf around your neck, but thin ones because the jacket does the insulation job without any help). The variety and large size of the pockets are other big advantages -- you'll be carrying thick gloves in those pockets, maybe a balaclava, maybe a smartphone.
I tried the jacket when it was 34 degrees F outside. Will it still be effective in 20? I guess I'll find out.

I bought the S size and it was like an XL
Sent back, they don't have smaller

reviews.name: DIY & Home Ltd
reviews.review: Great quality jacket with quality finishing and of course, nice and warm.

reviews.name: Stewart Hutton
reviews.reviewTitle: Nice Fall or Mild Winter Jacket
reviews.review:
I am 220 lbs and 180cm.
Nice fall or mild winter jacket. I purchased on sale for $54 Cdn, worth every penny.
If you plan on using as your main winter jacket, make sure you wear a sweater as well. I was outside in -5c with -14c wind chill and not being active, I could feel the cool air (maybe due to sizing. I normally wear XL but ordered XXL). Wearing the jacket walking in -5C with -11C windchill it was okay, kept me warm. If there isn't a strong wind chill this jacket would be suitable. I can confidently say this would be an awesome mild winter -5c & above or a fall jacket. The hood is a good size for a hat and there are 2 large and 2 small inner pockets. The outer hand pockets are lined and quite warm.

title: Carhartt Men's Relaxed Fit Washed Duck Sherpa-Lined Jacket
description: This men's Carhartt jacket is made of washed cotton duck that has a broken-in look and feel. It has a soft sherpa fleece-lined body that keeps your core warm, and the sleeves are lined with quilted nylon for easy on and off. #12-ounce, 100% ringspun cotton washed duck #Sherpa-lined body for warmth; Quilted nylon sleeve lining for warmth and easy on-and-off #Attached sherpa-lined hood with hidden drawcord #Pleated elbows for ease of movement #Internal rib-knit storm cuffs help keep out the cold #Pleated bi-swing back for extra stretch across the shoulders #Left-chest pocket with zipper closure #Two inside pockets #Two sherpa-lined lower-front pockets #Back length: Large regular: 28"; Large tall: 30" #Imported

reviews.name: Jason
reviews.review: I have owned a standard carhartt hooded coat for 12 years. It had the arctic lining and was great if you weren’t working. Thing was too hot for splitting wood or shoveling snow. This coat has a Sherpa lining which has held up well over the past year I’ve owned it. But the best feature is the fact that the cuffs stay around my wrist when I drive. I’m 6’1 and the previous carhartt I owned the cuffs would ride up to my lower forearms when I drove my truck which I hated. These stay put and have extra outer material that lays over the cuffs for extra protection and warmth. Wind doesn’t pass through this coat and is very warm but not too warm where you can’t work. The tail flap in the back hangs lower which is nice too when bending over so you’re not giving anyone a show. If you’re a bigger guy on the fence about this jacket get it you won’t be disappointed.

reviews.name: shopping fiend
reviews.review: Bought for my son-in-law to replace the one he had for 10 years. He loved it, very durable material and warm enough for North Carolina winters.

Got the XLT. Boy does it fit good! I'm definitely still keeping it! Looks good and with a few layers I'm not worried about getting cold. But if you want the thick boy, you need to get the next step up in the "warm rating" by Carhartt. This one is 2nd from the top.

reviews.name: Jason
reviews.review: Great jacket, fits well and super warm. Lots of compliments on how it looks. I think it is a fair price.

reviews.name: Brett P.
reviews.reviewTitle: Fits both too large and too small, but only just barely.
reviews.review:
I've bought many jackets like this and this one is just a bit on the oddly-sized side of things.

For perspective, I am a 240 lb 6'4" man with wide shoulders, long arms, and a solidly lean and muscular build, so finding clothes that fit me has always been quite challenging. That is, as most shirts and jackets go up in size, they usually increase in trunk size, but not much in arm length. So, it becomes difficult to find jackets that fit my shoulders and arms, but don't leave my torso swimming.

This jacket is no exception. It fits a little on the boxy side in the trunk since it does not have any taper to it, and the arms are about an inch or more shorter than I'd like them to be. I ordered this jacket in XL, but I have jackets that fit me perfectly in sizes ranging from L to XXXL depending on brand, so it's always a guessing game.

That being said, this jacket seems to be well-constructed and decently warm. I just wish it fit better because it looks very good!

reviews.review: Me gustó mucho. Es muy caliente y el diseño está padre. El precio se me hizo muy bueno también. Lo único que se le podría criticar es que sí se llega a sentir muy sintética, pero por el precio, se te olvida (una chamarra así, de piel real, costaría 5 o 6 veces más).

Also think it'll be the perfect warmth, although I have not yet worn it out as it hasn't been cold enough.

Ordered a large which was okay at the waist but tight at the shoulders and chest. Item returned.

Dickies iconic "IKE" Eisenhower jacket is lightweight, but warm. Durable 8 ounce vat dyed twill fabric with a 4 ounce nylon quilted lining and industrial wash friendly. The IKE remains one of Dickies most popular selling jackets today for work or just cool casual styling. Hidden interior pocket
Two-piece sleeve; one-button cuff
Polyester/Cotton Twill, Lining: Quilted Nylon Taffeta

reviews.name: Andeejay
reviews.reviewTitle: Fits better after I sized down
reviews.review: Great looking Dickies ike jacket and well constructed sturdy jacket to last years. I'm 5'9" 200 lbs 44" Chest with love handles😋and I mostly wear XL shirts and jackets. I've had a black Ike jacket in XL for a few years now and it always felt too bulky. So I finally got around to trying a Large in the Moss color and it fits way better, and looks fantastic! Still a little bulky, but more tailored looking as you can see in my pics where I compare the Black XL version and the Moss Large version. Also showing the zipper closed where I still have room for my belly and shoulders in the Large. So I recommend sizing down unless you want a relaxed fit or plan to add really thick layers under the jacket. I was also worried the moss color would be too light but it's not as you can see in my pictures. I also show the inside pocket with my regular sized wallet inside and has room for more. Dickies make great quality garments and overall I'm very happy with my purchase😁!

fit him very well.

reviews.name: Ray Barnes
reviews.review: Though I wish they had a tall version of this jacket it does work as advertised. It's a little bit snug around the chest and waste. It will keep you warm and conforms to your movements. You can wear this as a casual jacket but it's recommended for work.

reviews.name: VictorVal
reviews.review: Cost a little bit more but totally worth the extra money. You can find similar jackets but they suck.!

reviews.name: OMNiLAST
reviews.reviewTitle: Good price good item fast delivery.
reviews.review: HEAVY DUTY , GOOD QUALITY, nice Product

reviews.name: Linda Barrett
reviews.review: My husband loved it

reviews.name: David Thompson
reviews.review: Use it for work ‘ It’s All Good’ Thanks 👍

reviews.name: ryan salter
reviews.review: It’s odd, the unlined eisenhower jacket is made of the same material as the 874 pants, but the lined jacket is not, looks shiny, needs to be heavily broken in. Zip seems fine for now. My only beef is the sleeve cuffs are HUGE, I’m going to take the button off and move it out a bit to make the sleeves fit better and tighter. There’s no doubt the quality of Dickies have plummeted in recent years, if you’re looking for a jacket to last, go find an older Carhartt. (New Carhartt is just has bad as new Dickies) That’s consumerism for you, if you make a jacket to last 10+ years, they won’t be making any money for a while, if they make a trash jacket that lasts 1-3 years, well there you go. I’m not using this for work, as I know it won’t last 2 days in the yard.

reviews.name: Kurt Stokes
reviews.review: Great jacket and very warm. Be aware of sizes. I ordered a xxxxl on their sizing chart to fit me. It suggested ordering a xxxxxl. I’m glad I didn’t. The xxxxl was too large so I had to have it tailored. This isn’t a complaint. The jacket is brilliant. Be careful of the sizes.

reviews.name: Christopher Pope
reviews.reviewTitle: Very nice jacket but a few niggles
reviews.review: Have a selection of carhart and dickies jackets and I wanted one of these as it's smart enough for work and civ use. I ordered my usual size (L) and ut was HUGE. returned and bought a medium and fits just right! Only issue is I wish it was a little longer as it sits just above the waist or on the belt line. I'm 6'2 and 100kg. Arms are a little baggy but allow for room for a under layer. Is overall a nice jacket and I receive plenty of compliments with it :) worth a try just order a size down!

reviews.name: ZephyrFella
reviews.review: Great valued product perhaps with more wear it will start to shape but quite the cardboard shape to begin with would recommend perhaps in different colours?

reviews.name: Andy
reviews.reviewTitle: Take a size down when ordering (large => medium)
reviews.review:
I love this jacket, but the sizing is seriously out. I ordered the navy blue in a large (my usual sizing) and the jacket that came was freaking huge! After a prompt return and exchange I now have the medium and the jacket is now spot on.

A few things to note: the bottom of the jacket does sit quite high on the hips. The zip is not great as it keeps sticking but you can rub a wax candle along the zips teeth and this helps hugely in making the zip move more freely. I would suggest the coat is more an autumn and spring coat one, though it is lined I can see the jacket not coping with extremely cold weather. But all of that aside though I love it.

title: Levi's Men's Sherpa Trucker Jacket
description: Warm sherpa insulation for cold-weather. Soft quilted lining in sleeves.

reviews.name: Joshua H.
reviews.reviewTitle: Levi and Carhartt are the coats to last a lifetime
reviews.review: So I read that it was suggested that you size up, but I’m going to say it blatantly, size up! My wife bought me this exact coat last year for Christmas but I’ve lost a lot of weight so it was too big. I decided to get another because you couldn’t beat the sale  had on them. I got a large because that’s the size I usually wear in shirts and hoodies. I should’ve got an X-Large, I work in a warehouse that’s freezing in the winter and boiling in the summer. I put on a long John shirt and a sweater and my shoulders are so tight I can’t move them lol!! So definitely size up!! Other than that this coat is the warmest I’ve owned other than Carhartt.

reviews.name: Jeremy
reviews.review: I was a bit worried that at the price I paid ($58), i would receive a knockoff. I'm happy to report the jacket appears to be genuine. The MSRP on the tag attached was $98, so I feel it was a good deal. The jacket is stylish and well made. I have noticed no flaws and it held up perfectly in the wash (cold water and low heat in dryer/line dried) on the day it came in. At 6'4" and 205 lbs I would have preferred a large tall but it wasn't available so I ordered XL. The fit is pretty good; a bit roomier than I need but with a sleeve length that is almost perfect. The jacket is warm enough for my climate (SE Texas) but would probably not be sufficient for sub freezing days. As others have said the sleeves aren't lined with the faux wool HOWEVER they are lined with quilted nylon so the whole jacket is lined. I'm very happy with the purchase.

reviews.name: Maria G.
reviews.review: I Love it so much Good for a Women as well I mostly wear 2XL.or 3XL depending on the brand I went up a size 4XL it fits big I don't mind I like over size Blue jeans jackets so I can layer . My husband loves it so much he wants to buy on for he self.. I recommend to buy it Levis makes good quality clothing its worth it . I plan to buy more colors

reviews.name: BBQ Johnny
reviews.review: First the warmth on this jacket is amazing. The dead of the cold in the east with this and a hoodie you’re set. It fits perfectly and feels rugged. It’s a truly great product and it turns heads. Tons of compliments with each wear, “nice jacket” “is that a trucker blue” “Sherpa lined nice” just to name a few. If your thinking of it just get it you won’t regret it. Clearly this piece will get better over time also.

reviews.name: Slim
reviews.review: I really like these jackets Color: Juniper Rinse they look new not like they've been used like the stonewash ones. Last spring, they were on sell for 30% off $70 I got a Large it fits me goods as expected. But Michigan's winters I like to wear a hoodie under it, the Large was a little tight with a hoodie. So, on Cyber Monday I was looking for some Levi pants and I see the jackets was 50% off $54 so I brought Extra Large so I can wear a thick hoodie under it. I have two brand new identical jackets!

reviews.name: Lee
reviews.review: The port color is a little darker than what the picture shows but I like it more. Im 6’3 170 and got the large. It fits well like how a Sherpa should fit. Right above/at the belt line with shorter sleeves. Sits at my wrist when standing causal but rises up a little bit when reaching. Would recommend 👍 if you want a longer fit than go with a Tall size

reviews.name: Lupe
reviews.review: I gave this to my husband as a Christmas git and it was a hit! It looks really nice. The dark color is really nice. It fits very well too. Would recommend.

reviews.name: Paul C. Appel
reviews.review: This jacket is great for 40 degree weather. It has easy snap buttons, warm lining and feels very comfortable all over.

reviews.name: theodore moore
reviews.review: I have a few Levis jackets which I have purchased directly from a Levis store and I love the fit and feel. This one is a fake. Dead giveaway: the label is made from CARDBOARD. Overall the fit was dumpy, the denim feels thin and cheap, and the stitching and craftsmanship just feel off. Pretty disappointed. Buying all my Levis from the store from now on.

reviews.name: Customer
reviews.reviewTitle: Order one size bigger then you think.
reviews.review: I own this exact coat from about 7 years ago. Everything was the same, the label in the collar said made in china, XXL just like the one I ordered here. When the new one came, the sleeves and the length were both two inches shorter then my old one. Did the Chinese measuring tape shrink? Very disappointed as I wanted another coat just like my old one and, of coarse, they don't have an XXXL. Had to send it back. It was a hassle free return though.... thanks for that.

reviews.name: Kira
reviews.review: I bought this jacket for my boyfriend who is 6'4'' and 230lbs in a size XXL. His normal size is XL so this was a bit big but that is exactly what we wanted so that he could layer it with a hoodie. The denim is incredibly soft, the fur is cozy and the arms are well lined and warm.

reviews.name: AceyDeucy
reviews.review:
I absolutely love this jacket. Reminds me of the one I had in the 70's. Great for cold climate. I bought one size larger to accommodate layering.
The buttons, as indicated, are actually snaps. I like the snaps, they are just like the original jackets had when they were made in a different country,
Problem remains the ad saying they are button closure.

reviews.name: BarryK
reviews.review: It is actually a much better looking jacket than in the displayed photograph. It is more olive green than the photo than brown or perhaps call it olive brown. The outside of the jacket is actually a fine corduroy and I love it. It's a perfect fit and warmer than I expected. For the sake of convenience I just wish it had a zipper. But it's an excellent jacket at a great price. Highly recommended if you are into trucker style jackets.
